direccion: Km. 5 Via Yuracrucito, a 3 Km. del Arcangel, Ibarra 100150 Ecuador
descripcion: See why so many travelers make La Estelita their resort of choice when visiting Ibarra. Providing an ideal mix of value, comfort and convenience, it offers a family-friendly setting with an array of amenities designed for travelers like you.La Estelita features a concierge, to help make your stay more enjoyable. The property also boasts a pool and free breakfast. If you are driving to La Estelita, free parking is available.During your visit, be sure to check out one of Ibarra's popular delis such as La Hacienda Cafe Delicatessen, La Botica Café, and Annapurna, all a short distance from La Estelita.At La Estelita, your comfort and satisfaction come first, and they look forward to welcoming you to Ibarra.

comentarios.p_comentario: La vista de Ibarra y Yaguarcocha son fascinantes. La limpieza de habitación y áreas comunes son evidentes. La amabilidad del personal contribuye muchísimo para tener una experiencia agradable. Me encantó tener lugares donde caminar tranquilamente que además de estar cerca también ofrecen un plus a la estadía en este establecimiento.

El personal muy atento y servicial, además de la comida muy deliciosa y el desayuno completo. Mi parte favorita de la visita a este lugar fue la hermosa vista que tiene desde muchas áreas del lugar hacia la ciudad Blanca y sus atardeceres. Súper recomendado!!!

Atención personalizada, amable, personal muy dispuestos a solventar cualquier requerimiento para que nuestra estadía sea la mejor. Muy limpio todo, las habitaciones acogedoras.  La comida del menú muy buena Recomendación: en la fecha que nos alojamos la noche fue muy fría y hay que considerarlo si van con niños pequeños.

The most wonderful views and setting. Very comfortable rooms, great staff and perfect surrounds. The food was delicious - I recommend the smallest dining room with a view, by candlelight, for dinner. Easily the best place I have ever stayed.

El paraíso en la tierra. Ampliamente recomendado. Un lugar para conectarse con lo maravilloso de este mundo. Una vista insuperable, deliciosa gastronomía, seguridad en sus instalaciones y la amabilidad de su gente, realmente hacen que la estadía sea una experiencia maravillosa.

Un rinconcito cerca del cielo asi puedo definir a la Estelita, lugar mágico con una vista encantadora instalaciones confortables limpias atención de primera volvería una y mil veces mas , comida exquisita

Excelente comida, que servicio, Internet muy buena, que increíble vista. Todo lo que se necesita para pasar un excelente fin de semana en Ibarra. Desde la piscina se tiene la mejor vista de Ibarra. El café, demasiado rico, si es que te gusta.

Unforgettable stay at Estelita. The infinity pool is AMAZING and stayed warm all 4 hours we were in it. The staff even let us stay 20 extra minutes! Everyone is helpful, courteous and accommodating and the food was yummy and fresh. The ride up along the mountain side is great for thrill seekers. Views are breathtaking along the pool, breakfast den and behind the hotel. Can’t wait to come again!

Stayed in July 2021, was a very positive experience. Very clean! Staff super nice and helpful. The pool was amazing. Staff allowed us to orders appetizers poolside. Mountain views  are to die for and shouldn’t be missed. Very much a place to visit with friends and/or family.

Amazing location with beautiful Views.  The staff is amazing and accommodate every request we asked for.  It was a unbelievable stay with the best of memories I would highly recommend the hotel. We had a late even pool party.  The staff brought us How much is the sandwiches for a crowd of 20.  It was great appreciated for a snack before bedtime.

direccion: Panamericana km 4. 5, Ibarra 100150 Ecuador
descripcion: ACCOMODATIONS: 50 Rooms with modern bathrooms, 13 of our rooms have chimneys, 23 of our rooms have DirecTV• RESTAURANT SERVICE: National & International Cuisine with ample wine selection • ENTRETAINMENTE every Saturday during lunch hours we have live music and folkloric dances, Indian choreographies with authentic and colorful costumes.• Movie and Karaoke lounge Pool table, darts and fusball, family roomReading areas with peaceful and beautiful scenes• INTERNET SERVICE: Wi-Fi available in all rooms and all areas of the Hacienda• BUSINESS CENTER • SPA

comentarios.p_comentario: Grand confort malgré l'altitude, grâce à une délicieuse bouillotte ; vraiment parfait. Repas et petit déjeuner copieux. Grand silence en pleine nature. Très bon accueil à la réception Grande sérénité des lieux

La Hacienda - Hosteria Chorlavi es simplemente fantástica! La mejor atención y servicio al cliente la puede uno disfrutar desde inicio a fin, absolutamente recomendada! La comida, las habitaciones y los amenities en general, mas un clima privilegiado y una ubicación estratégica, hacen de este lugar un "must" para viajes de placer o negocios!

Muy lindas instalaciones yo me iba a quedar 1 noche solamente y en esa noche el.jacuzzi estaba frio y el sauna un poco sucio, no se pudo disfrutar las áreas humedas, deberían estar listas a toda hora todos los días

Es una hostería muy bonita, con actividades para niños y estupenda comida, cercana a sitios turísticos, con lindos jardines y un ambiente familiar, piscina, spa, gimnasio, canchas y precios adecuados  al establecimiento.

La comida es muy buena se recomienda el locro de papa lo sirven bien caliente y en plato de barro. Las instalaciones son amplias y limpias, con áreas verdes para caminar y disfrutar de la naturaleza. La Hacienda que tiene su historia y puedes conocerla a mas profundidad visitando su salón de memorias... Recomedado!!!

Staying in Hacienda Chorlavi was definitely one of our best stops in Ecuador, from the moment we arrived (with a kind offer from the hacienda to arrange us a transport) to the very last moment. The place is absolutely beautiful, surrounded with nature, a beautiful light and decoration, wisdom in each corner and lots of love and attentive gestures from the staff— adding to the food variety and quality, there are many beautiful thoughts and prompts spread around the place.  The rooms are very spacious as well as comfortable and well decorated. Besides all these beautiful elements, the Hacienda offers a lot of different options and opportunities one can entertain himself with. All of this combined, creating a very personal and wholesome environment.  It was an amazing opportunity to come and stay, relax, as well as engage with the culture of Ibarra. We can’t wait to be back. Thank you so much!  Carmo y Carolina…

Es un hermoso lugar para compartir con la familia tanto grandes como chicos, a pesar que nunca vimos la presentación folklórica que ofrecían, hay muchas actividades por hacer. El desayuno delicioso buena atención.

Buen servicio,  habitación limpia y reconfortante para la noche, buena opción que coloquen bolsas de agua caliente antes de dormir eso ayudo mucho a mejorar la expericiencia, lo que compaginaba con el trinar de los pájaros y el sonido de la lluvia.

No es ningún lugar de lujo pero es muy cómodo y el personal es muy amable. Había muy pocos huéspedes por la pandemia así que el restaurante estaba cerrado para la cena y no había opciones cerca para cenar, pero por las molestias me ofrecieron un cuarto mejor al que tenía reservado. Eso se aprecia mucho. Me tocó una habitación muy amplia y cómoda. Quizá las instalaciones podrían renovarse pero a la vez que sean un poco antiguas le da cierto encanto. El desayuno me pareció excelente. Sí lo recomiendo.

It is a sweet, quaint property, but I could hear cars from my room while sleeping. However, I am sure that there are quiet rooms. It seemed that there was some construction and most of the property was vacant (probably due to covid). The property is a bit outside of Ibarra. The breakfast was lovely, and the staff was super friendly.   The room and bathroom are elementary but perfectly comfortable. The bed was only okay, but I was not expecting anything fantastic.   If I find myself in Ibarra again, I will stay here!

direccion: Street Juan Francisco Cevallos 1-53 y Obispo Mosquera, Ibarra 100150 Ecuador
descripcion: Fevilamir HOSTEL welcomes you! An ideal place for a relaxing restful for domestic tourists and international in the White City of Ibarra , the province Imbabura , surrounded by lakes and breathtaking and stunning landscapes in the heart of the Andes , Republic of Ecuador . We invite you to stay in our hostel Fevilamir , hoping to enjoy a stay pleasant and enjoyable in our province. Our website allows you to discover our comfortable rooms and know us as hosts .

comentarios.p_comentario: El mejor Hostal de la ciudad de Ibarra a pocos minutos del terminal terrestre ideal   para pasar vacaciones en familia, viaje de negocios , en pareja, etc sus instalaciones nuevas ,ambiente acojedor, personal capacitado para la atencion.

Great location, close both to the bus station and the train station. Everything you would want to see at a walking distance. Pleasant staff. All basic needs taken care of, including hot and good pressure shower - but the bed could have been a bit softer. Hotel is right next to the market, with the (+) and (-) that come with it, but as far as I'm concerned it had more of an added value - managed to buy some very tasty fresh fruit right next door. Great value for the price.

Buena relación calidad-precio. Buenas limpieza y trato amable y servicial. Cercanía  a la estación de buses que conecta a la ciudad con otras zonas turísticas. No es muy zona muy segura, pues es bastante oscuro por las noches

Cuando viajé quedé gratamente impresionada por las habitaciones, el único inconveniente es que el barrio no está bien iluminado. sugeriría que el hotel ponga más luminarias en su puerta parta que los usuarios nos sintamos más seguros.

Eine super Unterkunft wie ich bisher in Südamerika noch nicht gefunden habe, alles sauber und sehr freundliches Personal. Die Unterkunft liegt mitten in der Stadt gegenüber des Mercados Amazonad. Habe dort 2 Monate gewohnt. Komme bald wieder.

Muy buena la atención las personas que atienden son muy amables y el lugar es acojedor las habitaciones muy limpias y amplias tienes todo lo necesario el precio es bajo y muy recomendable para que lo visiten  los turistas que viajen ala ciudad blanca de Ibarra.

A small family business with the most loving service and environment. Clean, quiet and very close to the market. Everything you need is close by including the central bus terminal. Strongly recommended it and I’d definitely go back.

Muy buena atención las personas son muy amables y el lugar es super céntrico esta cerca del terminal y el mercado central La habitación tiene todo lo necesario y es muy acogedor y el precio es bajo es muy recomendable

Una linda localidad, muy bonito por dentro y por fuera, se destacan en su atención, sin duda alguna me volvería alojar en este establecimiento, aunque a veces los perros ladran e interrumpen el sueño, pero no es muy relevante

Habitaciones limpias, cama super grande y la habitacion de las mejores en Ecuador, es un Hostal con caracteristicas de un Hotel cuando vuelva a Ibarra seguro vuelvo a alojarme en este precioso lugar.  Recomendable 100%.

direccion: Linea Ferrea Km 167, Ibarra 100150 Ecuador
descripcion: This agro-tourism ten-acre working farm and family–owned hotel, operated with social responsibility principles, overlooks a river canyon with views of two (and sometimes three) volcanoes. It is located ten minutes from the city of Ibarra, Imbabura. At an elevation of 2.192 m (7,200 ft), we have spring weather all year long, with temperatures ranging between 10-27oC (50- 80oF). Open as of December 2011.

comentarios.p_comentario: Dormir con el croar de las ranas, despertar con el sonido de los pájaros, Un desayuno campestre, orgánico y detallado, habitaciones confortables, el olor de café recién filtrado, el paseo por sus plantaciones, y todo, a cinco minutos de Ibarra. Simplemente lo convierte en un lugar hermoso. De aquellos de los que no quieres irte. Carlos y su personal, son amables y cálidos. Hay tanto espacio libre y al mismo tiempo privado, que no requerí usar mascarilla. Y algo de recalcar. Aceptan mascotas, y mi perrita lo pasó fabuloso. Definitivamente, vale la pena cada centavo que inviertes. Gracias por los hermosos días.

This small property offers a restaurant where is ideal to visit for breakfast or tea time. They offer a variety of original snacks and vegan alternatives. Price is very reasonable and service is very good. They have coffee plantations and it is a good organic coffee. When visiting with kids, there is plenty space to play and walk around. They have orange trees, mandarin trees around the trails, as well as avocado trees. There is a place where you can spot hummingbirds and other local birds that come to feed. It is a wonderful cozy place to spend with the family with beautiful views of the mountains. It is located 5 minutes away from Ibarra city. For those who want to stay, you can! They offer lovely cottages as well.

The Cananvalle hostel is a very cozy place, it is in the city of Ibarra. It is a place to be with nature, in addition to the warm climate of the city of Ibarra. Also, there are beautiful dogs that guide you around the property all the time. The food service is excellent, the food is very tasty. Although there are some complications to get to the place, such as google maps does not correctly indicate the way to go. Everything else is very beautiful, it is an excellent place, I highly recommend it.

La hosteria es un lugar en medio de la naturaleza. Hay un río muy cerca. El paisaje andino es cautivador. La atención muy cordial. Los desayunos deliciosos. Te sentirás como en casa. Pasamos el fin de año 2018. He colocado diciembre 2019 porque no hay otra opción.

Ein sehr persönlich geführtes Hostal, das Teil eines Gesamtkonzepts darstellt, in dem auch Kaffeeanbau, -produktion und in Kürze auch eine Cafeteria mit Kusrangebot betrieben wird. Frühstücken mit Blick auf Kolibrischwärme, Avocadobäume, Kaffee...schlichtweg wunderbar. Besitzer Carlos und sein Team stehen jederzeit mit Rat & Tat zur Seite.   Ibarra wird bei den wenigsten Menschen auf der 'Bucketlist' stehen, aber diese malerische, sehr gepflegte Hosteria liegt idyllisch im Grünen, Ibarra hat in der direkten Umgebung sehr hübsche Wandermöglichkeiten und eine nette kleine Altstadt. Der indigene Marktplatz Otavalo und die Lagune Cuicocha sind schnell per Bus erreichbar.

Excelente clima, magnifica atención y limpieza. Un sitio sereno y tranquilo para un verdadero descanso en familia. Maravilloso en contacto con la naturaleza: árboles, montañas, nieblas y pajaros Muy agradecido.

We loved our time at Hosteria Cananvalle and are already planning our next trip there. The family that runs it is so lovely and makes you feel welcome from the first minute. There is every type of fruit tree and flower around the property, beautiful cures and trails. It’s hard to believe it’s just 10 minutes from bustling Ibarra. Our kids loved the treehouse and board games and we loved the coffee, breakfast and views of colorful birds right out the window...not to mention the spa and great massages! Thanks for an amazing time!

You won't find an overall better place to call home in Ibarra. The beauty is on display from the moment you drive into this extraordinary property, but the real beauty is in the people who will care for you and treat your like family for your stay.   Our family stayed for seven nights. Carlos was out traveling himself, but we were in the capable hands of his niece Karla and nephew Andres.   We are usually low maintenance people, but this trip had us in Ibarra for the PanAmerican Youth rock climbing Championships and we had specific needs for food and transportation that Karla helped us manage effortlessly. Tranquillo she reassured me. And her help and reassurance was a blessing.   Andres kept our athlete and us fed to perfection. As did the wonderful ladies at breakfast. Everything was fresh, delicious and plentiful.   Our home, the cabana de familia, was comfortable and the perfect amount of space for a week's stay. The view over the river looking toward the train track (we only saw it twice, always during the day) just makes you smile and feel alive to be in a place so magical.  The property is an oasis, plain and simple. Hummingbirds, flowers, avocado, lime, lemon, orange trees. The views of the volcanoes before the fog sets in. While we were there, the property hosted a local wedding. Just seeing the spaces they created for that special occasion and the food they catered, I couldn't imagine the place could get more wonderful, but it did for that lucky couple's special day.   If you find yourself in Ibarra, this is the place. Full stop.…

Excelente lugar gran trato de sus dueños, el desayuno esquisito muy bien escojidos los productos, fruta, yogurth, cereales, pan de casa, cafe pasado, mermelada, acompañada de hermosos sonidos de pajaros y colibries que se adminiran desde el comedor

Ibarra n'étant qu'une étape sur notre route, nous n'avons passé qu'une nuit, mais si nous avions eu le temps nous serions restés plus longtemps! Le lieu est magnifique, dans la nature (et proche du centre d'Ibarra et de la Panaméricaine), au calme. Nous avons été très bien accueillis. Nous y avons pris tous nos repas et avons très bien mangé! Beaucoup de produits viennent du jardin. Du restaurant, vous pouvez voir les colibris qui vont et qui viennent devant vous. Nous recommandons vraiment cet hôtel! PS: Petit déjeuner excellent devant les oiseaux contrairement à ce qu'indique un précédent témoignage

direccion: Av. Atahualpa 15-142 Juan Francisco Bonilla, Ibarra 100105 Ecuador
descripcion: Looking for a place to stay in Ibarra? Then look no further than Hotel La Giralda, a hotel that brings the best of Ibarra to your doorstep.Guest rooms offer amenities such as a refrigerator and a desk, and guests can go online with free wifi offered by the hotel.Hotel La Giralda features a 24 hour front desk, room service, and a concierge, to help make your stay more enjoyable. The property also boasts a pool and free breakfast. If you are driving to Hotel La Giralda, free parking is available.While in Ibarra be sure to experience nearby Mediterranean restaurants such as La Pergola Ibarra, Pour Toi Gourmet, or La Bella Italia.We’re sure you’ll enjoy your stay at Hotel La Giralda as you experience everything Ibarra has to offer.

comentarios.p_comentario: A few years ago, we visited the city of Ibarra, the city that when entering there was a message that said "White City, to which one always returns", this message always remained in my memory from the first time, because it has all the reason, its people were very friendly and a welcoming city.  On the recommendation of several friends of my parents, we stayed at the Hotel "La Giralda", where there were several options in terms of rooms, in this case as we were my parents, my sister and I, they requested a double room and a double with an accessible cost of $ 105.00 including breakfast, sports fields. They provided all the comforts such as hot water, private bathroom, television, internet and water. For the use of the pool and whirlpool it had a cost of $ 10.00 per person; as well as the restaurant with exquisite dishes prepared by the chef of this hotel. On this day that we arrived in the city of Ibarra, we visited some places in its surroundings and when we returned to the hotel we had a very good rest, like being at home. The next day in the morning the included breakfast was used, which was American type that contained: coffee, tea, aromatic water or chocolate plus bread, jam and butter, fried or scrambled eggs with bacon and juice. When we leave here we use the sports courts until menu time where we request a shrimp cocktail, quinoa soup and a strong grilled cutlet. and the dessert figs with cheese. That had a cost of $ 5.00 per plate. We had a pleasant experience and highly recommended to all who are looking for a stay while visiting this beautiful city.…

Recomendado para hospedaje. Las habitaciones son confortables y cómodas para disfrutar de un merecido descanso.  Tiene cancha de tenis y parqueadero.  Puede mejorar los salones para eventos que requieren mantenimiento

Buen hotel, cómodo y con un restaurante con excelente comida y con una atención de primera.  Recomiendo los pollos preparados al estilo portugués, deliciosos!.  En general las habitaciones buenas.  Hotel recomendable

Pasamos con mi familia desde el día viernes 1 al sábado 2 de noviembre y en general no recomiendo el hotel para descansar el ruido por la noche es insoportable y los baños apenas tienen un tamaño adecuado. Lo mejor de todo es la gente que trabaja en el hotel, que es principalmente lo mejor de mi estadía. Si buscan descansar y gustan de una buena área húmeda de piscina y sauna, no les recomiendo este lugar

La honestidad demostrada por las personas que trabajan ahí ne gan dejado muy gratamente impresionado. Gracias por vuestra honradez. Es el valor más importante que debe tener un hotel. Con mi familia si viajamos a Ibarra siempre iremos al hotel. Saludos desde Ambato

Tuvimos la oportunidad de hospedarnos en el hotel La Giralda, excelente atención y  buen serviicio y delicioso menú. Un hotel muy acogedor ideal para el descanso y relax en sus confortables habitaciones y espacios de entretenimiento: piscina, sauna, hidromasaje.

Definitivamente un hotel para visita de trabajo a la ciudad, la relación calidad precio es buena, el servicio de su personal es bueno, el check in excelente, nos solucionaron peticiones especiales. Claro que regresaríamos.

Pasé una noche en el hotel es cómodo, personal amable, la comida está bien pero a la hora de dormir se escuchaba el ruido de las otras habitaciones y cuñado la gente caminaba por el pasillo, le volvería a dar una oportunidad solicitando una habitación mejor ubicada

Pasamos de visita por Ibarra, nos topamos con La Giralda, un hotel bastante agradable, buena tarifa y se puede descansar  El personal es muy atento y amable, están siempre atentos a los detalles  Las habitaciones son confortables y limpias dignas de un buen descanso Y su restaurante es bastante bueno y la comida de calidad  Puedo recomendar este lugar para cualquier viajero

Lo único rescatable es la atención del​ personal. Baños pequeños. Se inundan. Habitaciones ruidosas y con olor a humedad. Las cortinas dejaban ver a través de ellas y las puertas son de vidrio. Cero privacidad. Hay habitaciones sin ventanas. Caro por lo que es.

direccion: Ave. Mariano Acosta 1638 And Cristobal Gomez Jurado, Ibarra 100150 Ecuador
descripcion: Hotel Ajavi is an excellent choice for travelers visiting Ibarra, offering a family-friendly environment alongside many helpful amenities designed to enhance your stay.Hotel Ajavi features room service and a concierge, to help make your stay more enjoyable. The property also boasts a pool and free breakfast. If you are driving to Hotel Ajavi, free parking is available.If you’re looking for a barbeque restaurant, consider a visit to Chamuyando, Ibérica Ribs, or La Parrilla del Tio Jessy, which are all conveniently located a short distance from Hotel Ajavi.Enjoy your stay in Ibarra!

comentarios.p_comentario: Pésimo servicio!!! El personal es maleducado y groseros. En el baño público de la cafetería no hay papel. La cafetería dice que cierra a las 22:00 pero a las 21:00 ya no quisieron atender. No pudieron dar opciones de donde conseguir comida.

Buena ubicacion, cerca de un centro comercial y lugares para comer, habitacion muy comoda y amplia, desayuno buffet de buena calidad, excelente atencion, con parqueadero propio, precio razonable para la ofreta del area.

Spent here one night with a friend in late December 2021. Very nice and clean hotel, breakfast also nice – although we came late and it was almost finished. But excellent fruits were still there. And the coffee was super strong, just right for us.

Hotel Ajavi is a great choice for travelers visiting Ibarra, as it offers a family-friendly environment, as well as numerous services designed to enhance your stay. This hotel offers free wifi, hot water, cable TV and more services that are available to the client.  Hotel Ajavi has a concierge and room service to make your stay more pleasant and safe. The property also has a swimming pool and also includes breakfast. If you are driving to Hotel Ajavi, free parking is available. The people who work here are very friendly. Also if you are looking for restaurants, there are many of these that are very close to Hotel Ajavi. There are also many places you can visit, also not far from Hotel Ajavi. If you visit Ibarra I recommend it.

The hotel has new and old rooms, we were in a new, spacious and comfortable room, the facilities generally good however you see that they are old, the breakfast varied and good taste.  The pool area is seen to be renovated however it needs a better cleaning of the pool water.  The location is good, it is close to the city center by taxi 5 min.  The cost is high in campared to the quality and rating of the hotel.

Es un muy buen hotel. Esta casi completo, tiene hidromasaje, piscina, gimnasio, sala de juegos, turco y sauna. Las habitaciones muy confortables y limpias. El desayuno es Buffet aunque no hay mucha variedad es muy bueno.  Tiene tarjeta para ingresar a las habitaciones no llaves. Me gustó mucho el lugar aunq aún el precio es un poco alto $$ pero si lo vale.

Durante el pasado mes de abril del presente año 2019, fue organizado un evento académico internacional en las instalaciones del hotel Ajaví. Espacio confortable y acústico con ingreso dual, parqueadero disponible y sanitarios debidamente aseados. Es una opción válida y afrontable con cálida atención de sus anfitriones. Realizar cualquier otro evento que se desee celebrar, constituye una alternativa de singular consideración.

El día de hoy 6 de Junio fuimos a reservar habitaciones para los asistentes a un evento que se realizará en la ciudad de Ibarra en el mes de Julio. Lamentablemente la atención por parte de la recepcionista fue  de lo peor que pudimos recibir. Un hotel sencillo, bonito, en remodelación,  pero lamentablemente con el peor servicio. Hay mejores opciones en la ciudad de Ibarra.

This traditional, remodelled hotel has all the current comfort you are looking for, either to visit nearby sites or on a business trip. I stayed there on a busines trip and really got all the comfort I was looking for to get rest for my next hard working day. It has got beautiful gardens, a pool and a dely, where you can go for coffee and a sandwich. If you wish to stroll around, it is nearby shopping centers and supermarkets, as well as nice restaurants.

Had to wait 30 minutes for hot water. Room was clean, bed was ok. Food ok but was sick after eating their egg soup. Wait staff mostly pleasant. Large group came in our last 2 nights, very loud until 3 am no regard for others

direccion: Avenida 13 De Abril 17-54 Y Esmeraldas, Ibarra 100150 Ecuador
descripcion: San Andres Lodge & Spa is located in the northern province of Imbabura, also known as the "Province of the Lakes". The city center of Ibarra, is only 7 minutes away from our lodge, and the best known tourist attractions are only a few minutes away. Take your time to enjoy Imbabura and all it has to offer from the "Plaza de Ponchos"in Otavalo, to the leather crafts in Cotacachi or the wood carvings in San Antonio. Our restaurante is opened daily from 8am to 9pm offering a wide variety of suculent options. Sauna, steam bath, and covered pool are exclusive to our guests. Looking for relax? ... we offer massages with different techniques that will sure take your tensions away. 24 beautifully appointed rooms from single occupancy to family accommodation will surely satisfy your needs.

comentarios.p_comentario: Excelente atención, un lugar cómodo, limpio, agradable y lleno de tranquilidad. Lo visitamos con mi esposa y mis nietas, estuvieron felices. Jardines muy  amables. Piscina climatizada, instalaciones impecables. El desayuno incluido es muy completo y agradable.

Estuvimos con dos amigas en Nov 2 al 3 llegamos un poco noche y Nos tocó un cabana en la cual había varias goteras q mojaron todo mi equipaje y la escalera que va al segundo piso por el cual mi amiga se cayó y se golpeó en varios sitios de su cuerpo. Al siguiente día informamos de lo sucedido al front desk pero no hubo ni siquiera una disculpa mucho menos alguna compensación por todo lo ocurrido. Realmente  una falta de profesionalismo increíble por parte del personal

Es una hostería con los dormitorios muy básicos, si se hospedan aquí lleve plancha, reloj, radio, secadora y lo que necesite porque en las habitaciones no hay nada más que la tv y la cama, las toallas muy duras, podría estar mejor, no hay mucha facilidad para llegar, las puertas del parqueadero sólo funciona una que es la primera si se pasa les toca mucha vuelta por la distancia.  Recomendación para los dueños  dar un buen mantenimiento.

Fuimos con mi esposa y como siempre la atención es muy buena del personal que atiende y del sabor de sus platos son muy buenos, en esta ocasión aprovechamos un gran descuento que existe de una tarjeta de crédito. Recomendado

Empiezo valorando la atención de primer nivel por uno de los personales más atentos que he conocido en un hotel pequeño. El lugar es bonito y todo es funcional, nos dieron un upgrade de habitación gratis por estar mi esposa embarazada, las habitaciones son bonitas pero sencillas, las camas cómodas aunque las almohadas no tanto, pero si pides más almohadas o cobijas te las dan. La masajista fue excelente y las instalaciones son buenas. El único defecto es que el agua caliente por ser solar falla casi siempre y hay que estar pidiendo a cada momento que prendan el calentador a gas para tener agua caliente de verdad y a veces ni eso calienta suficiente el agua. Por lo demás una muy buena experiencia.

We enjoy the pool, garden, fish ponds. Outside it’s very beautiful. The restaurant has very good Food, the flavors were amazing. The rooms could be more decorated and have better amenities. Towels need to be cleaner

Es un hotel muy acogedor con habitaciones muy cómodas , el restaurante es buenísimo me encantó a toda mi familia el personal es súper  atento.  Buen lugar para descansar o para eventos.   El desayuno está incluido con la reservación

Lo mejor del hotel es su personal, super amables y atentos. Nos hospedamos ahí de camino a Pasto. La habitación la encontramos limpia y con todo lo que necesitábamos para pasar una noche, nos facilitaron todo lo que pedimos y estuvieron atentos a nosotros. El precio también muy bueno. Volveremos cuando estemos nuevamente en Ibarra.

Ubicación: mala, calidad costo/beneficio: terrible (caro para lo que ofrece el hotel), mantenimiento entre malo y pésimo, habitaciones sucias, lo rescatable el jacuzzi, telefono en la habitación: dañado, piscina: agua helada, desayuno: re básico, resumen, no lo recomiendo.

Fui con mi familia en el feriado de semana santa, el personal es muy amable desde la reserva hasta la salida, siempre están pendientes de las necesidades de los huéspedes, las habitaciones son cómodas y bien cuidadas, el área húmeda es un poco fría ya que no está completamente cerrada, el menú del desayuno es muy básico, el buffet no ofrece suficientes opciones. La relación costo calidad es excelente, muy buena opción para hospedarse en Ibarra.

direccion: Hwy 35 (Panamericana Sur Km 8, Ibarra 100150 Ecuador
descripcion: Set in Natabuela, 10 km from Central Bank Museum, Hotel y Hosteria Natabuela offers accommodation with a restaurant, free private parking, a shared lounge and a garden. All rooms feature a TV with cable channels and a private bathroom.

comentarios.p_comentario: We spent 3 nights (4 days) of our Ecuador vacation at Hosteria Natabuela... It was wonderful.  The staff,,, including the owner, went out of their way to make our stay exceptional.  The hosteria is next to the Pan-American Highway, so even though we had no car, we could easily take the bus to the major attractions in the region: Otavalo, Peguche waterfall, Atuntaqui, Cotacachi etc...   We had a quiet, very clean cottage.   The gardens were beautiful.  The restaurant was excellent...I wish we can give this hosteria more than a score of 10.  We will be back on our next Ecuador vacation!  (The price was also excellent).

Fuimos con muchas expectativas, el precio que indicaban en Booking, terminó siendo más alto por los impuestos, y para el servicio recibido terminó siendo costoso.  Las habitaciones son muy ruidosas, se escucha el ruido de la carretera, las conversaciones de las habitaciones cercanas y la bomba de agua que se activa a cada rato.  El desayuno es bien pobre y al personal no parece importarle - no hay opción de escoger nada. El café muy malo, jugo de tomate para todos y unos huevos revueltos absolutamente salados. Pedimos cambio, pero llegaron igual. Al segundo día decidimos desayunar en Ibarra y nos fue muy bien. Muy variado y a 2,50  por persona.

We were in Ecuador and lost our passports! After a very stressful day we decided to stay at this hotel because it was close. The next day Fernando( the owner of the hotel) heard what had happened and was so so kind. He gave up his whole day and helped us in so many ways. We found our passports and we couldn’t have done it without him and his staff. Besides the point that they have such great service the hotel is beautiful. It has beautiful plants and very comfortable cabin rooms. Thank you Natabuela!

Die herzlichen Gastgeber waren sehr hilfsbereit was unter anderem die Unterstützung bei der Organisation von Ausflügen in die Umgebung betraf. Die Lage des Hotels an der Panamericana wirkt sich nicht negativ aus, da das Hotel in einem schönen, ruhigen Garten liegt, der von einer Mauer geschützt wird. Außerdem ist es so sehr einfach Ausflüge mit dem Bus z.B. nach Otavalo etc. zu unternehemen. Die Küche ist gut und der Naranjilla-Saft ein Gedicht.

Fuimos con mis amigos el fin de semana del carnaval y nos quedamos en 2 cabañas medianas. Las cabañas muy lindas y cómodas, el baño estaba muy bien y la chimenea dentro de la habitación fue perfecta para la noche fría. La comida en la mañana estuvo bien. Nada fuera de lo común. La piscina, sauna y turco funcionaban perfectamente. Lo que realmente marcó la diferencia fue la atención personal del dueño. Se preocupó mucho por que estuviésemos bien atendidos y contentos. Supo que una chica de nuestro grupo cumplía años y se portó muy generoso con nosotros. Botella de vino y todo! El lugar es muy agradable y la flora lo hace muy relajante.

Hostería Natabulea is a beautiful place to get rid of stress. It is located in the province of Imbabura 20 minutes from the city of Ibarra.  The facilities are very beautiful. The hosteria has a rustic architecture and out of the ordinary. It has ample recreational spaces for adults and children, recreational games. It has a restaurant, swimming pool, sauna as the turkish bath, soccer field on natural grass, billiard room, table football and table for playing cards, private parking, wi-fi service and most importantly a chapel, Where we had a small meeting.   I had the opportunity to visit her along with my friends and Priest of our parish, we had a retreat and we had to stay in this nice place.  The people who helped us with the reception were treated kindly. The rooms have many wonderful decorations; all have fireplaces and private bathrooms. It has a patio to rest, and the hammocks and take a nap.  The vegetation is unique in this place, there are flowers of all kinds and trees with beautiful blooms. The breakfast was very delicious, (the cost covers breakfast) the people who served us dressed in the typical Natabuela costume.  In addition we were able to play football among friends in the field of this place that is in perfect conditions, also has a cover that protects it. Then we went to enjoy the pool is heated water and has deck. It is perfect.  The lunch was spectacular, we were served typical dishes of the area of Imbabura, the natural juices very delicious. There is also bicycle rental. Where you can visit places of the Hosteria. We stayed one night and one day at this place, enough time to realize that this place is awesome.  I recommend visiting this wonderful place, it is a bit pricey but worth paying.…

Fui de negocios, pero al llegar no todos los servicios estaban habilitados, no habia piscina ni restaurante, sin embargo, el personal de la hosteria hizo todo lo posible para darme la mejor atencion.  sugiero anticipar al huesped las novedades antes de llegar a la hosteria.

Sometimes finding a good place to lay your head while on business can be difficult, especially in Ibarra.   This time I stayed in Natalbuena and they had an excellent staff, decent amenities and a great cabin feel to my business stay.   The internet worked well and was very safe. I will definitely return here.

We were a party of 13, the Front desk gentleman was very helpful in getting us rooms that accommodated our party. The rates were very affordable, the attention was excellent. He went out of his way to show us around the facility. Was extremely friendly. Family operated business that shows the pride they have in the family business.

Ambiente acogedor cerca de todo para conocer. Muy buen servicio y dedicación para ayudar y hacernos sentir muy bien. Muy buena comida la tarifa incluye un desayuno muy bueno Definitivamente inclusive por sus precios es una de las mejores opciones

direccion: Calle Galo Plaza Lasso La Esperanza, Ibarra 100101 Ecuador
descripcion: Our refugio is a very special place in the middle of the mountains, surrounded by lots of green. We are located just 15 minutes from the Historical Center of Ibarra, a 0.30 USDbus or a 4 USD taxi ride away. From our refugio you can go on ecological trecks by yourself close to the hostel or join hikes organized by us. We are the starting point for many different hiking routes in the region and we can offer you a multitude of options. However, our main destinations are Imbabura just behind the house and the symbol of our region Imbabura (8-10 hours), Lago Cubilche (4-5 hours), La Routa de los Karanquis (8-10 hours), The Three-Waterfall-Trek (4-5 hours), The Hidden Thermal Baths (8-10 hours) and many more! With us you also have the opportunity to learn how to make traditional leather crafts, we would love to help you to make your own souvenir! In the evening you can have a cozy time by the fire and learn how to dance "San Juan", a typical dance with sombreros and ponchos.

comentarios.p_comentario: Emerson is a very nice guy, full of good vibes and recommendations to hike and discover his region that he loves. More than a professional mountain guide he is also an amazing artist who creates leather creations from bracelets to very fine horses saddles. The place is the perfect refuge to visit imbabura region,climb cubilche or imbabura volcanos. Fire, chalet ambiance, good coffee and food. Books and terrace. You feel in ur family.  The village around is little but nice with some little typical restaurants, food shops nand little supermarkets. Lot of bucolic roads around Truly recommend

Un lugar acogedor para visitar y descansar, las habitaciones muy cálidas y cómodas. El cariño con el que reciben a sus huéspedes es muy gratificante y los espacios son muy acogedores para disfrutar en familia.

Es un lugar muy acogedor y brinda espacios y paisajes para disfrutar en familia. Su decoración muy original y creativa que demuestra sus raíces y se aprecian recuerdos de sus visitantes. Recomendado 100%.

Excelente, un hogar fuera del hogar☺️ Unos días de grandes experiencias, con los mejores amigos, un lugar acogedor y único. Sin duda pronto volveremos para seguir disfrutando del privilegio de hospedarnos con los mejores 🤗

Bon hostel pour les voyageurs en quête d'aventure, de randonnée et de découverte du pays. L' hôte est un vrai bon guide qui saura vous faire découvrir sa région et les montagnes. J'ai apprécié mon séjour et les personnes que j'ai rencontré grâce à Emerson. Le logement est spartiate mais parfaitement adapté pour ceux qui savent se contenter de peu, car en recherche d'authenticité

This place is definetly a "refugio" and was the perfect stay for my hike to the Imbabura the next day. It feels really comfy with the chimney and the whole interior design. The owner Emerson really cares about his guests and gives a lot of important recommendations for hikes or other trips and does everything to offer you a nice stay.

Gemütliches Hostel mit Gemeinschaftsräumen zum entspannen drinnen und draussen. Idealer Ausgangspunkt für Wanderungen auf den Imbabura und Cubilche. Der Betreiber ist Bergführer, sehr hilfreich und freundlich.

We stayed in Terra Esperanza hosted by Emerson for 3-4 days. The location is great to go hiking to Imbabura and some other areas. We picked the place because Emerson can take you to different hikes in the area which includes Imbabura, Cubilche, Ventanas, and a few others. We enjoyed hiking a lot! Emerson is a good guide, and his dogs made us a great company! Hikes are a bit challenging but doable if you're acclimatized (though we didn't try Imbabura). See some photos from the hikes attached to the review. The rooms are very basic. We stayed in a room for a couple but there are also shared rooms. The rooms don't have heating, so it may be cold at night (there are quite a few blankets to keep you warm, however). On the plus side, there are a couple of fireplaces to keep you warm! The water in the shower is somewhat warm, so it is best to take shower during the day while it is not yet cold, and perhaps this could be an area for improvement by replacing the water heater.  The views from the backyard, and just over the area, is amazing when there are no clouds. Emerson's mom served us breakfast, lunch, and dinner which were great! By the way, there are not that many options available around the place, so it was  great that we didn't have to go searching for places to eat. Overall, both Emerson and his mom were very welcoming and helpful. If we were to go hiking in this area of Ecuador, we'd stay here again!…

Refugio Terra Esperanza is a rustic destination away from the more urban city of Ibarra. The owner Emerson is not only your very friendly host, he is also an accomplished alpine hiker and may serve as a guide if you wish. Staying at this location gives you the unique opportunity to be directly under the hiking trails for the volcanic Cerro Imbabura and Cerro Cubilche. The views of the landscape and mountain peaks from right in behind the hostal are amazing!

A charming place with a homely touch that invites you to feel comfortable, the people who attend are very friendly and do not hesitate to tell you anything you need, the stay is so comfortable that you feel at home from day one, tourists usually They stay more days than they expected, it has hot water, comfortable and warm beds, internet and other amenities, the town is charming and going for a walk in the morning is magical, you can feel the Andean style. Coming to this hostel has been one of the best decisions I could make for my trip, now the desire to return and live this magical experience arises within me. 100% recommended

direccion: Caserio Primavera, Ibarra 59362 Ecuador
descripcion: The hacienda is located three hours Northwest of Quito and one and a half hours Northwest of Otavalo and Ibarra The same family has owned the hacienda for over 90 years. Renovated luxury suites.

comentarios.p_comentario: Having traveled the world, we have finally discovered the most beautiful, peaceful place on earth! Jose and Daniella, who manage this remarkable hacienda which is located in an area that is half jungle and half  cloud forest;  are a very special young couple who almost  immediately became like family. Their talents are many: from being accomplished  musicians, to having a vast knowledge of  architecture and interior design, obvious in all the unique details of the Hacienda. They are also completely attuned to what your individual interests are and will design itineraries accordingly.  For us, we went to Cotacachi,  a top quality leather town; stopped for famous biscuits in Cayembe, went on a tour of the Galletti coffee plantation  which culminated in experiencing delicious Galletti coffee, selected as the #1 artisinal brand in Ecuador; hiked to see beautiful butterflies, and after dinner, enjoyed sitting around a fire pit where we roasted marshmellows and at our urging , Jose and Daniella sang for us.  The rooms all have breathtaking views of the mountains and valleys and are both cozy and have many up to date comforts. It was magical to be enveloped by clouds and bird song in the morning and sunlight during the day where you can see for miles around, many brilliant  shades of green. There is also a beautiful pool filled with refreshing spring water; wonderful Ecuadorian meals and a full bar where sophisticated cocktails are available. Kudos to the lovely, talented chef and bar tender. The entire atmosphere is completely conducive to rest. We all slept in a way we hadn't, since Covid hit New York City. Believe me, we all felt 15 months of tension drain away. I know this sounds over the top, but Hacienda Primavera really is a Shangri-la. Do yourself a favor and stay no less that two nights. Ideally more to get the full benefit of all Hacienda Primavera has to offer. …

I spent 5 nights in the remote lodge. The staff were fantastic and the meals fresh and adjusted for my likes. I had hoped to do some birding and was not disapointed.Tanagers, toucanets, Saltators all came to eat the fruits off the trees on the property. And the property is very close to The Dracula Reserve that hosts many other flycatcher, tanagers, flower pierces and the rare white-faced nunbird!Alex was friendly, helpful and spoke great English! He made this place even more enjoyable! Wonderful place!

This Hacienda located high in the Andes Mountains makes you feel as if you are experiencing a wonderful dream. As if the dense variety of flora and fauna are not enough, the Hacienda is staffed by a small group of the most attentive, warm, hard working people on earth. You can spend your days hiking to nearby waterfalls, riding horses, or just swimming in the idyllic pool listening to the birds. The food is excellent and thoughtfully prepared. Our 17 year old Vegan received delicious specially prepared meals as did the rest of us non Vegan meat eaters. A simply wonderful place, not to be missed, and appropriate for all ages. We are determined to return.

This wonderful hacienda is about 3 hours north of quito in the beautiful cloud forest. The scenery is spectacular. The staff at the hacienda are warm welcoming and professional. Our host, Alex, couldnt do enough to make our 6 day stay amazing. We rode horses, white water rafting and hiking. The food was wonderful. This is deffinately a must do for anyone in Ecuador. Dont miss this beautiful Hacienda in a breathtaking part of Ecuador

I still feel this is one of the most beautiful places I have ever been to.  I just spent seven glorious days there in mid-February.  Once again, the service goes beyond amazing - on all levels.  From the wonderful meals, to the beautiful room, to the horseback riding, hiking, bird watching, the list goes on and on.  The staff at the Hacienda (Alex, José and Pati) make you feel so incredibly special in all that they do for you.  I will be back!

This is such a beautiful spot, with mostly unsculpted gardens around the main house. Butterflies, brightly coloured birds, hummingbirds, flowers and fruit trees are all fun to see yet calming and peaceful. In our two full days/3 nights, we ate delicious and perfectly seasoned meals, hiked to 2 different waterfalls, walked along the banks of lovely rivers/rapids, visited an orchid farm, had an Ecuadorian cooking class with the chef and relaxed in the hammock or on the porch of this lovely place. We saw the horses and the bulls as they moved through the pastures. We also got to see much of the nearby villages. There is also lots of relaxing down time when not exploring. Great wifi, and comfortable, clean rooms,  All the staff were amazing, and many thanks to Alex the hotel manager, who was our tour guide and driver,and to Patti and Jose who provided great food and service and the other staff who were friendly and very helpful. We were very happy to be there, what a special and tranquil place!…

After nine days in the Galapagos, I wondered if my experience staying at Hacienda Primavera could be nearly so special.  The answer is a resounding YES!  No one should miss this opportunity to be in an Ecuadorean, ecological preserve with dramatic clouds descending over the valley.  Chez Patti prepared the most amazing meals and Jose was so professional, smiling, and courteous as he managed the dining area.  They made me feel at home.  Alex, who picked me up at the airport and oversees all activities at the Hacienda, went above and beyond to make sure I enjoyed all the region had to offer. He took me for drives through small towns so I could see how rural Ecuadoreans live--they all seem to know him, waving and chatting.  We visited waterfalls and saw vistas with cows grazing and farmers tending crops.  Alex took me to Esmeralda's orchid nursery, and I was astonished to see hundreds, perhaps thousands, of amazing and diverse orchids, many of which she found herself in forests. Don't miss that unique experience if you go.  I enjoyed horseback riding with another opportunity to say hello to the local people.  For me, the true highlight was the 3-hour mountain hike to see if we could spot the elusive, Cock of the Rock, Ecuador's most famous bird.  It was a challenging adventure as Alex led the way, cutting through vines and thick vegetation, and our reward at the top was to admire a dozen or so of these beautiful, orange-red birds and hear their unusual calls.    I highly recommend Hacienda Primavera as a destination as worthy as going to the Galapagos, and I want to thank Pepe, Alex, Patti, and Jose for providing me with memories I will cherish forever.…

We arrived at primavera in the dark following a long drive up from Cotopaxi. Our driver Alex also acted as guide, general front of house, interpreter, advisor and all round good man. He could not have been more helpful and made our stay very special. The Lodge went out of their way to sort out any questions, arranged our transfer from Cotopaxi and back to Quito. The lodge itself is magnificent, perched high in the hills surrounded by green covered mountains. Sunny mornings were followed by the clouds. Birds and butterflies everywhere. Easy hill walking alongside wonderful rushing rivers. Horse riding good too. The food was superb, hospitality first class, a truly lovely place to stay. Peaceful, verdant and well run. Thank you.

I have vowed to visit Hacienda Primavera at least once a year for the rest of my life, and to date I have accomplished that.   This is an amazing place, with phenomenal staff, outstanding service and vistas unlike anywhere in the world.  Everything about this visit, from start to finish, was absolutely outstanding. The quick response from owner Pepé, the pick up in Quito, the delicious meals (and cooking lessons) from Paty and José, and the service from Alex (which is hard to describe as he goes so above and beyond...).  If you have the opportunity to visit Hacienda Primavera for more than one night (preferably three or more!), then do it.

It's a challenge to add anything new to what is said in other reviews. From the moment we arrived we felt as if we were home in the best sense of the word. The corner room was beautiful and as we opened the glass doors to the balcony a hummingbird greeted us. Sounds of the river, rain, frogs and insects lulled us to sleep at night.   We hiked, rode horses, took cooking lessons, went bird watching, had happy hour on the porch, visited the local school, watched Pati play soccer in Gualchan, visited the high altitude paramo and more.  All the activities (and the relaxing) were wonderful but it's the staff that makes Hacienda Primavera such a special place. Pati's food was delicious and I miss my daily Ecuadorian breakfast and guanabana juice. Jose is the perfect waiter and housekeeper. Giovanni led us on hikes and a horseback ride. Alex is so engaging, personable and helpful that he became like our Ecuadorian son!  If you want to experience Ecuador away from the crowds and in a truly special place, just go. You won't regret it.…

direccion: Av. Jaime Rivadeneira 555 Oviedo, Ibarra 100150 Ecuador
descripcion: We care about you. Being a small Hotel allow us to attend you in a more friendly and familiar way. So can you can ask for some insider tips or just tell us how your day was. With 33 rooms and 2 suites, Hotel Montecarlo is located at the heart of Ibarra. Every room has a private bathroom with hot water, cable TV and a telephone. We have Internet WiFi it's free for our customers. You can relax in our Jacuzzi, Turkish bath or sauna, as well as enjoy our small gym and swimming pool (only weekends and national holidays). You can also enjoy a very delicious cuisine in our restaurant. We also provide a conference room for events and meetings. We care also about the environment and therefore we heat the water for the rooms mostly with solar energy among other measurements.

comentarios.p_comentario: Me gusto la atención,  la comida genial,  las cenas sin súper ricas , las orientaciones que me dieron para visitar lugares turísticos fue de gran ayuda , volvería a ese hotel , la habitaciones normales .

Todo en el hotel es viejo exceptuando quizás las TV, absurdamente caro para lo que recibes, no regresaría a hospedarme, no tienen ascensor, ni llaves de tarjeta, el baño también le urge una renovación

Habitaciones limpias y cómodas un poco pequeña la q nos ofrecieron a mi y a mi flia pero estaba bien por una noche, el desayuno aúnque no lo decía en las aplicaciones q visite si esta incluido, fue una grata sorpresa, y te ofrecen un pequeño bufett,con frutas, panes, quesos, jamones, cereales, yogourth, muy bueno, el precio es bastante razonable.

buenas instalaciones, hotel muy limpio, gente amable nos habilitaron el turco y la piscina en un dia que no estaba habilitado, el desayuno buffet muy bueno con varias opciones para elegir. la ubicacion del hotel es muy buena centrica con facil acceso a varios lugares de la ciudad

Lo que me gustó: Ubicado en una zona muy céntrica Buen delicioso desayuno buffet Nos permitieron acceso a piscina e hidromasaje durante día de semana Cuenta con parqueadero interno Cama muy cómoda.  Lo que no me gustó: La habitación es muy permeable de ruidos, se escucha cláramente a los huéspedes en otras habitaciones y los autos de la avenida. La ubicación del inodoro es muy estrecha, prácticamente pegado al lavabo. Tuve que llamar dos veces a recepción solicitando toallas. La velocidad del WiFi da mucho que desear.  En general una buena noche de descanso, los detalles que deben mejorar lo harían una excelente opción de estadía.

Nice hotel, friendly staff Decent breakfast included in the price. A short walk to the center of town. The owner, Francisco, speaks English and is very helpful. Rooms are small but well maintained, clean and comfortable. I stay again without any qualms.

Aceptable en general, sin embargo debe mejorar los colchones y almohadas son incomodas, buena ubicación, desayuno muy bueno, habitación comoda. El servicio bueno, amables pero falta mas información sobre sus servicios.

Todo bien la estadía. Cuarto limpio, bonito, baño nuevo. Buen desayuno. El Hotel esta cerca de todo, puede uno llegar a los principales lugares a pie sin problema y dejar el carro en el parqueadero, ya que en Ibarra es dificil encontrar parqueadero en el centro, además hay que pagar para estacionarse en la calle!!

Un hotel muy agradble no es la primera vez que nos hospedamos, pero cada vez que visitamos ibarra es la mejor opcion por su cercania a todo, la amabilidad; incluso vimos sus instalaciones mejoradas, es una buena opcion para viajar en familia en pareja o por trabajo.

el hotel sigue siendo hermoso ha sido remodelado de la ultima vez que visite, me encanta llegar a este lugar la comida es muy deliciosa y variada, me gusta la comodidad que tienen las habitaciones, disfrute mucho estar en la piscina con mi familia fue una buena opción pasar el feriado en este lugar.

direccion: Autopista Internacional de Yahuarcocha KM 5, Ibarra 100150 Ecuador
descripcion: We are committed focused in offering a world class service and exclusive entertainment activities. Hosteria Totoral is the home of travelers looking for adventure in a peaceful environment. We are well prepared to host executives coming to do business in Ibarra and who wish to quiet and calm time after a long working day. Featuring its 14 Acre land full of beautiful gardens, Hosteria Totoral gives its guests the privilege of enjoying its Marina and water sports, such as kayaking and fishing. Our facilities include, tennis courts, paddle courts and a soccer field, all of them can be enjoyed by our customers completely free of charge. Our guests can enjoy a horseback ride within the property limits, as well as free bicycle rides. For those more adventurous, there are plenty of trails in the surrounding area, as well as the 10 kilometer bike path around the lake.

comentarios.p_comentario: El fin de semana hicimos una boda y en general no recomiendo el lugar, tuvimos súper mala experiencia en todos los sentidos: 1) Pésima atención por parte del administrador y del gerente comercial. Básicamente no escuchan al cliente ni sus necesidades desde el inicio. Mucho tiempo en responder y enviar la información requerida. 2) El menú está sobrevalorado en precio para la calidad de los ingredientes y del chef. 3) Los meseros no son profesionales de hostelería, se les caen los vasos sobre los comensales, piden dinero para volver a casa, desaparecen, no traen los ingredientes, se van. Pésimo servicio. 4) Amigos de la administración, se unen a la fiesta sin permiso, se toman el alcohol. 5) Nunca lo vi, te quieren cobrar por adelantado el 100% antes de iniciar el evento. Y a los huéspedes también. Fatal servicio…

My family and a few friends booked this place in advanced and paid a 50% deposit. Due to local regulations because of COVID-19, the event we were attending got cancelled temporarily.  I called the hotel, spoke to customer service representative Vanessa and requested to change the date of our stay. I was assured that it was OK.  Then, on the date my family and I went, the hotel staff wanted to charge us 100% of the booking again and said that the deposit was void. Furthermore, they even told me the ridiculous excuse that the customer representative who had assisted me was not authorized to make those types of reservation changes. After the manager called the "Commercial Manager", they both told us in a very rude manner that there was nothing we could do and that we could either pay in full or leave.  If you don't want to be scammed, stay away from this place.…

Las instalaciones son amplias. Los grandes peros la cocina, el servicio y las actividades. En la cocina demoras de hasta UNA hora en pasar los platos, menú escaso (no tienen algo elemental como sánduches), carnes mal cocidas, comida salada, lomo de pescado mal deshuesado, no venden vino por copas, etc. El personal que llevó el equipaje lo votó y pisó con el coche y no dijo una palabra. En cuanto a la cabaña que utilizamos la televisión no tenía ningún tipo de señal y el personal de la hostería lo sabía con días de anticipación y no lo arreglaron. En la noche quise comunicarme con la recepción por interno  y nunca me contestaron por lo que tuve que llamar al teléfono de la página web de la hostería para que me atiendan. La piscina que es pequeña no tiene posibilidad de reserva para evitar aglomeraciones y potenciales contagios Covid-19. No tienen servicio a la habitación. No tienen cuidado de pedir uso de mascarillas a quienes ingresan. Tampoco tienen ningún juego de mesa. Al momento de cobrar no saben hacerlo en una sola factura sino que cobran dependiendo del tipo de consumo -- A quienes estén pensando en ir a Hostería Totoral NO les aconsejo para nada ya que van a tener una pésima experiencia. PD.: Lo único rescatable la limpieza y el servicio del SPA…

Somos 10 personas. Hagan el cálculo...   Las instalaciones bonitas! El paisaje kncreible. El spa nada mal. *Pero la atención de llorar*.   1. Al llegar nadie nos recibió era por poco autoservicio y el señor que nos "ayudó" con las maletas se le enredó un  tira de una maleta en el coche y terminó dañando la maleta.   2. La puerta de la habitación: la llave de la habitación era un desastre. Nos tocó llamar varias veces al lobby por que no entraba o no salía la llave.   3. Hora de almuerzo: se tardaron 50 min en pasarnos la comida a la mesa. Para colmo, la hamburguesa estaba salada, la carne dura, los filete mignon servidos en plato de sopa, muy complicado de comer.   4. La ducha: literalmente tenías que tener la ducha ABIERTA 20 MINUTOS para que se calentará el agua. De ecológico no tiene nada.   5. En la noche quisimos ver TV: la TV no tenía antena, estaba de adorno en la habitación. No tenía señal y llamamos al lobby desde el número de la hostería por que desde el teléfono de la habitación marcamos durante 20 minutos y nadie contestó. su respuesta fue que debieron avisarnos que esas cabañas no tenían tv.   6. El desayuno: llegamos a las 9 a.m. a desayunar. (Avisando la noche anterior que íbamos a ir a esa hora). Habían ocupado la mesa que reservamos a pesar de nosotros llegar puntuales y nos tocó esperar 40 min a que estuviese libre una mesa y comer de apuro por que teníamos programado masaje a las 10 a.m.  7. La piscina: la piscina no cumple con el aforo permitido. La entrada es libre tienes que estar cazando que se desocupe un poco y rogar que no lleguen más personas. El hidro sí es bajo reserva.   8. El almuerzo (del día siguiente): la mesa la alistaron rápido.  Pedimos la comida... pasaron 1 hora 5 min y se acercaron a decirnos que perdón la demora que tenían un evento y estaban a full (exactamente la misma excusa del día anterior) y que aún se demoraban. Cancelamos la orden.  9. El checkout: mezclaron las cuentas de las habitaciones.....…

Es una verdadera pena ver como una pésima administración arruina un sitio que podría ser de los buenos lugares de la provincia de Imbabura. El área comunal tiene un diseño moderno agradable y cómodo pero el restaurante es pésimo tanto en variedad de carta como en sabor, sus meseros tratan de hacer lo posible por tratar bien al comensal pero no es suficiente para subsanar los otros temas. Por las normas de seguridad es un verdadero desorden los turnos y asignación de lugares. La organización deja mucho que desear y a mucho Personal les falta experiencia. Las cabañas y zonas húmedas son pequeñas y básicas, pero al menos ofrecen comodidad para el relax y descanso. El SPA tiene el mejor servicio del lugar aunque su infraestructura externa no ayuda a la imagen. El área verde es la mejor parte del lugar, amplia, bien cuidada, limpia y es muy relajante estar paseando por la misma. Aunque falta aún invertir en ciertas zonas del lugar hay que reconocer que la inversión ya existente es alta pero puede irse al agua si la administración no llega a ser tan buena como la música ambiental del lugar.…

Pésimo servicio, comida mala, se ahorran hasta el último centavo, no les importa el huésped, lo único que puedo rescatar que el área verde muy buen cuidado, en las habitaciones hay televisores pero no tienen servicio de cable, es decir es adorno

Llegamos a la hostería un sábado (ni bien empezó el feriado de carnaval) por dos noches. Esta hostería tiene muchísimas ventajas las cuales nos llevaron (con mi marido, mi perrito y una pareja de amigos con hijos) a decidir por este hospedaje para salir de la rutina de Quito en el carnaval.  Cosas muy favorables: 1-son petfrienfdly 2-las instalaciones son preciosas, tiene un sin fin de áreas verdes super bien mantenidas, la hostería tiene salida al lago, hay piscina climatizada y jacuzzi. 3-cuentan con varios tipos de actividades para pasar en familia o en pareja. *Paseo en caballos *Kayaks *Alquiler de bicicletas *Senderismo *Subida a globo estático (por San Valentín estaba está opción y el globo estaba ubicado en el hotel mismo). 4-el trato hacia nosotros fue servicial.  Cosas a tomar en cuenta (desfavorable): 1- en Booking aparecía que habían habitación de distintos tamaños (yo escogí "supuestamente" la más grande) y cuando llegamos nos dijeron que todas son iguales. Lo cual puede que en metraje lo sea pero en experiencia no, las ubicada en primera fila tenían terrazas todas equipadas con muebles para disfrutar de la misma y también tenían hamacas de descanso. Las ubicadas en segunda fila no contaban con nada de lo nombrado anteriormente. Y cuando reclamé que en Booking escogí la que tenía terraza amueblada el dueño me indico  deben ser fotos viejas. Además nos ubicaron en una cabaña que compartíamos prácticamente puerta con otros huéspedes que tenían 2 perros grandes (en ningún momento pretendía que la hostería sepa que serían perros grandes, pero si pretendía después de haber hecho la reserva con una semana de anticipación y tendiendo que uno debe avisar con precio anticipo la petición de llevar perro, hubiese esperado que no nos metan a todos juntos).  La opción que me dieron después de haber considerado irnos, es darle la última habitación al lado de la piscina que está abierta prácticamente todo el día y llena de gente y con un parlante de música sonando a todo volumen desde las 8:00 am sin importar si hay gente o no en la misma.  Al final nos dieron como alternativa un domo de lona que tenía su encanto pero no deja de ser una carpa de lona. En la noche hacia mucho frío (no hay un calentador) ya que no aísla el viento ni el frío y se entraba por distintos lados (ejemplo el techo o ventanas que se cerraban solo con Velcro) En la mañana hacia mucho calor (no hay suficientes espacios para abrir que puedas ventilar y permitir que el aire corra), la lona estaba caliente del sol.  Y para peor nos cobraron el mismo precio, que la habitación normal con paredes, sin tener frío ni calor. Totalmente exagerado cobrar lo mismo una habitación a una carpa (será glamping pero no deja de ser una carpa de lona). 2-el restaurante es de solo carne, no hay ninguna opción vegetariana y si avisas con anticipación que eres vegetariano (como mis amigos hicieron) te proponen solo menestras. No hay pasta, sopa o pescado (en los alrededores hay mercados de pura tilpaia) u otra opción. Les toco pedir a comida vegetariana de un restaurante y que le traigan al hotel. El desayuno es muy básico, eso no sería problema si fuera rico.  3-la música de la piscina empieza a las 8:00 y no precisamente con una canción tranquila, uno va a un lugar a descansar y se levanta con la música a todo volumen.  *Recomendación- llevar mucho repelente de mosquitos y tabletas para el cuarto. Los mosquitos de Ibarra son asesinos y al estar al lado de la laguna es imposible que no te ataquen.  3-el desayuno super básico y no estába rico.…

A very nice place to relax and spend with the family, out of the city and safe. Having the mountains and the lake so close is beautiful. It is a very large property with several options to spend with the family, the cabins are super comfortable, clean and tastefully decorated. Swimming pool for adults and children, and whirlpool. The staff are very friendly and its facilities are very cozy, the place is very quiet and its food is good, value for money, its recreational spaces excellent, an excellent climate and a very beautiful landscape. It is a place where I would return with pleasure.

This is the first review that I have ever left for a hotel, but I felt it incredibly important for safety reasons. First and foremost, DO NOT USE THE KAYAKS!!!  All three of the kayaks are severely damaged and pose a significant safety hazard, but the hotel continues to offer them to their guests anyway.  We had a very serious incident in the middle of the lake (explained below), and not two hours after our incident, the hotel offered the same kayaks to newly arrived guests. I briefly address other aspects of the hotel as well, but the kayak incident really needs to be shared. Had it not been for the kayak incident, I would have left a much more favorable review.  KAYAKS: The hotel has 3 sea kayaks that appear to have mud caked on the bottom. We later learned this material is putty used to plug multiple holes. The hotel will allow up to 3 people in each kayak, but only has five worn out life jackets. We were 2 adults and 5 children (ages 9-14) so the adults forwent life jackets to ensure the children had them - bad call on our part. Patrons are limited to 30 minutes on the kayaks and no warnings were given about the very real lake hazards. After leaving the calm lagoon and paddling to the middle of the lake, the kids tipped their kayaks, revealing the life jackets to be fairly useless. The wind and waves picked up dramatically, and there was NO ONE on the water but us, I suspect because some sort of wind warning was issued. We later learned strong winds, waves and currents are common in that lake, especially during the afternoon. One of the kayaks' internal compartments took on so much water that it capsized and became impossible to balance/use, leaving 7 of us in these conditions with 2 functional kayaks. We put 3 people in each kayak and had them start paddling back to the hotel; I swam towing the 3rd kayak. The 1st boat (with two 14-year-olds & a 9-year-old) made it back to the hotel grounds, but the 2nd boat (with an adult & two 11-year-olds) was unable to fight the wind. After 20 minutes of swimming, I reached the 2nd boat next to a dangerous floating reed system, which we also weren't warned about (basically, the reeds look like they grow on land, but the roots actually float on top of the water like a thick sheet of ice - very easy to get swept under). Due to the hazards and passengers' inability to fight the wind, I swam and pulled on the root system to pull both boats and three passengers back to the hotel against the wind; it took me over an hour to do so. No one came looking for us, and no staff was by the water when we returned. When they finally showed, we asked why no one had come to look for us as we had been gone for 2.5 hours and only 1 boat with 3 children had returned. They had no explanation. We also learned they had no resources to help (no extra boat, etc.). When we described the sinking boat, they claimed this never happened before, at which point I pointed to the poor patch job on the bottom of ALL three boats. After the water drained from a small hole for about 15 minutes, two grown men were still unable to remove the boat from the water because the "waterproof" section was half full of water. After additional draining, they were able to pull it out and use a larger drain valve at the front (for which they had no plug). We emphasized the importance of not using these kayaks as someone could be killed. Had I not been an exceptional swimmer (former competitor, lifeguard and Coast Guard), I honestly think we would have lost someone during our outing. The employees said they would relay this to the management; however, we later learned that just 2 hours after our incident, they offered the same kayaks to other guests. At checkout, the hotel tried to charge us for using the kayaks! After we protested, they offered us credit for use of the kayaks during a future visit. Seriously??? Eventually, they removed the charge.    OTHER: The grounds were beautiful. The horses were in great shape, but they could only offer two at a time. The rooms were nice, although ours was not serviced during our stay. Restaurant service was painfully slow, taking about 1.5 hours to receive dinner, possibly due to COVID; my daughter ordered a pizza, and ONE HOUR later, the waitress told us they didn't have pizza, so would she like chicken nuggets instead. The jacuzzi was lukewarm, which was fine during the day but not at night.…

Las instalaciónes y el lugar son muy hermosos, la naturaleza, el lago, las cabañas, sin embargo nos tocó unas toallas rotas y las camas rechinaba la madera, muy molestoso. Si cambian esto daran mejor servicio al cliente.

direccion: Flores 3-59 Entre Salinas y Maldonado Junto a la Discoteca Zoom, Ibarra 100150 Ecuador
descripcion: Our hostel is located in the center of the city of Ibarra and offers the hosting service in a quiet and comfortable environment with pleasant environments where there is the opportunity to meet guests from different nationalities and different cultures share.

comentarios.p_comentario: Cheap, and in the centre of the city. Imagine you are about to arrive in Ibarra and you haven't booked anything yet, well . . . do not look furthermore, this hostal is your best choice. It is cheap, and you may enjoy the proximity of restaurants, bars or cafés and cathedrals among other sights. . . So. . . it is cheap. . . .yes. . . it may be not what you expect in the rooms and perhaps they may need a hand of paint and some other things. . . . . But it is safe, the service is good (María the head of staff is very helpful), showers do their thing (hot 24/7), surprisingly WiFi is tip top (I held a videoconference for 2 hours with 40 participants without any issues), they have an arrangement with a carpark in the vicinity (2 minutes walking). . . . It is what it is. . . . cheap and the best option among this range of prices. Their garden and the birds which live there are lovely, nature in the middle of the city. Highly recommended.…

Backpacker is one of the most accessible hostels in Ibarra, as its price is not high since it includes services like free wi-fi, laundry service, and shuttle service. So it's a great offer and option. It has a courtyard area making it a really nice place, also the hammocks that hang between the courtyard columns give the place a relaxing touch, that is always appreciated. The people that work there are likable and always helpful when someone needs something. The location is just wonderful, being in the city center just opens a lot of new experiences, making it the perfect place to stay when you want to have a little getaway from home and routine.  Both times I was there, everything went perfect, the accommodation was pleasant, everything was clean and it gave a sensation of being in a safe place because the receptionist does not allow anyone who is not registered at the hostel to enter.…

Very good hostal location.  Workers are very kind and helpful.  Nice kitchen area in back with fridge and small stove. Cute courtyard area.  Could use a coat of paint in rooms, but overall comfortable.   Wifi good.

I volunteered in Ibarra for two months. I was travelling with my partner and we were looking for private accommodation for a great price. This was perfect.   We were given a private room with private bathroom and were comfortable. The staff made us feel at home the entire time.   The owners are excellent and will accomodate your every need. Further I just want to point out, based on previous reviews that they “do not lock the doors at night.” They most definitely do lock the doors at night time. It is bolt locked, two doors. You have to ring the door bell in which they confirm your identity before letting you back in.  Thanks for a great visit! You won’t find a better hostel in Ibarra.   Ally and Kirk x

My first negative review - the electric shower was faulty to the point where the wires were burning. When I brought this up with the staff they stated they were aware of this. What was frustrating was their decision not to warn me about the shower, and the fact they had tried to "bodge" it with some tape - how dangerous. When I asked for a refund, they declined.

I stayed here for 8 nights. Liked the location that was a few blocks away from the busy retail areas and Parque Pedro Moncayo in Ibarra. I would definitely stay at this hostal again in the future. Ibarra is a nicely located city away from the tourist crowds

Un hostal très mignon avec son jardin central et ses hamacs, mais affreusement vide: même à la réception ils s'esquivent !  Lors de notre nuit la bas, nous n'avons pas pu profiter d'Internet car leur connexion ne fonctionnait pas (nuit + journée du lendemain). Nous avons dû aller jusqu'à la place principale de la ville pour capter du wifi.  Les chambres sont propres, mais l'hostal étant situé près d'un karaoké les personnes avec l'oreille fine seront dérangées les vendredi et samedi soir...

The best place I love it'' this place is close to the centrum bank supermarket church and very clean., friendly people and the most important big and comfortable bed's. .. just for 12$fantastic. They have map's and also information about different place and activities in ibarra this hostal have hamaca and diferentes rooms with fantastic decoration every rooms is different I so happy to stay here

Un lugar muy acogedor en una cuidad muy linda, y una grata resepcion por parte de la administración, me encanto los lugares dentro del hotal incluyendo cafetería, sala de estar y corredores con lindos jardines, gracias por el servicio dado backpacker hostal!

I find the hostel thanks to a friends from Sweden who stayed there, the owners are awesome, they know a lot of places to landscape or to have fun they took me on a tour to the city the prices are really cheap, the rooms are great, cozy, new and kinda luxurious, the location is in the center of the city you can walk, there are a lot of restaurants and nice cafeterias, a lot of parks!!! totally recommended!!!

direccion: La Esperanza, Galo Plaza Lasso # 19-291 Vía a Olmedo Barrio Santa Marianita, Sector del Cuartel Yaguachi, Ibarra 100154 Ecuador
descripcion: Are you looking for a home away from home in Ecuador? Well that is exactly what you will find at this pictures, family run hostel in the heart of the Andes! Accommodation options include camping, dorm style and private rooms. Casa Aida offers delicious home cooked meals, hot showers, free WIFI, and guide services up Volcan Imbabura and other nearby locations!

comentarios.p_comentario: First, I have to say that if you're looking for luxury, do not go there. I knew that and was quite happy when I arrived there. Talking with Aida was awesome, she has seen so much people go in and out, it's crazy. Her anecdote are insane, I would recommend going there just to talk to her. I also did an expedition to Laguna Cubilche with her grandson or son, Jose. A nice day activity for the small price (30$). Jose was professional, funny, interesting, and helpful. However, the scenery (small hostel along an isolated road) and the fact that I was the only tourist there made me homesick. I stayed there 2 nights and would advise other to do the same. An overall great experience.   And the Hambergers are SO good.

Very nice place with a lot of opportunities. Hot springs, mountains, lakes, good food.  Gente muy servicial y agradable. Inmediatamente te sientes bienvenido y como en casa. Estoy feliz de haber descubierto este lugar. Muchas Gracias y abrazo
