Very friendly place with lots of history. Simple but comfy rooms with plenty of warm blankets to keep you cozy at night. Simple meals for a reasonable price. Shared showers and bathrooms. Very easy to reach from Ibarra - less than half an hour bus ride for 30 cents from parque Grijalva, and to go back just cross the street and raise hand for the next bus in about every 15 minutes.  The best part was availability of guides (thanks Charles!) to accompany all kinds of activities available in the area: you get delivered by camioneta right to the start point and back. Walking to the starting point is not much of an option because of the distance and chances to meet country dogs (some of them of impressive size!) on the way, so unless you have your own car, this is really the most reasonable way to do it. Climbing Imbabura would be a bit much for me, but Cubilche was more my size of adventure. The hotel dogs are real swat-hearts, Rambo is great mountaineer despite having only three usable legs after a road accident, and his mom is a beauty and a great explorer of paramo. Having both of them along for the hike added immeasurably to the enjoyment.  The hotel is actually placed on the main street of the village where there is house after house stretching all the way to Ibarra, which means there are some shops and a market available, but also quite a bit of noisy traffic. Inside however it is rural enough, including a view to a cow from my window (loved it!), and if you turn a corner off the main street, you are suddenly full on in the rural Ecuador with magnificent mountain views.…

This charming hostel is located at the foot of Imbaburra volcano. The place has a very friendly welcoming atmosphere. Jose is a mountain guide that can show you the local adventures. Excellent food and oustanding pancakes! Dont miss Aida telling the story of the hostel!

This is the story of Aida. Aida is 86 years old and the proud owner of @casaaidavolcanimbabura – the house we stayed at during our ascent to Volcan Imbabura. An orphan since age 7, Aida was born in the capital but soon after divorcing moved to a little village called Esperanza (Hope), where she bought a small piece of land with nothing but a hut and backyard. Having 3 kids to feed, she’d travel into town to sell a few burgers and iron hundreds of shirts overnight.  On a night in 1975, 11 Italian backpackers knocked on her door looking for shelter – all hotels in the city had turned them away because they were “dirty hippies”. Aida gladly offered them her backyard to set up their tents. Come next day, and unable to find anywhere else to stay, the Italians wondered whether Aida would have them for an extra night. It was Aida’s pleasure to share what little she had, however, she had no bathroom in the property. Seeing this, and in return for her generosity, the Italians built her a septic system. They stayed in Aida’s backyard for at least 2 months. Aida refused to receive payment, yet every day they’d always collect and present her with some money.  Over that time, word spread of a safe heave for hippies, in a village called Hope, open for backpackers from all over the world traveling Ecuador. Soon, more and more hippies showed up at Aida’s door. However, the attention was not well received and locals accused Aida of all kinds of things. Police, immigration services, and even INTERPOL showed up many times, yet Aida continued receiving travelers. She hosted them, taught them crafts, Spanish, how to cook, and even took care of their kids. Some stayed for days, weeks, months, and even years. She’s been a grandma, mother figure, and friend to many of them - with some even returning decades later to see her.  Aida keeps 6 whole books full of messages, in dozens of languages, dating back to 1975 from everyone that’s stayed with her. 46 years later, her property now has 23 cozy rooms to welcome hippies, travelers, backpackers, families, and anyone interested in rejoicing in her little home hidden amongst volcanoes in a town called Hope.…

I'm an old gringo hippie from the 60's and I'd read about a hostal in Ecuador where Bob Dylan and David Gilmore and lots of musicians and travelers had congrugated back in the day. I'put it on my bucket list when I moved to the coast of Ecuador a few years ago. Four of us on a wandering road trip in a van were lost while looking for the pyramids, and stopped to ask directions with some friendly locals. Both of our vehicles were pulled off to the side of a narrow street and our driver and their driver were drawing maps and giving directions. My friend Tito and were standing on the sidewalk next to the van. There was an open door into the buidling . next to us, and we casually looked inside. An older woman appeared and explained this was her hostal and invited us to come in. She was warm and friendly with sparkling eyes. As soon as we walked into the main dining area, I noticed the newspaper clippings of Bob Dylan. I GOT CHILLS. Casa Aide was my bucket list spot, and our host was Aida. We booked rooms. She and her daughter got dressed to go shopping for dinner, and we returned that night for a wonderful family meal. Much of it socializing in the kithcen while they were cooking. Her nephew is a sparkling 20 something man, speaks perfect English and is a wealth of information.  Synchronicity IS always perfect.        …

Casa Aida is a hidden gem, with a lovely private grassy courtyard, wonderful food and the delightful company of Aida. Aida is an interesting woman with many stories and decades of hospitality experience. She is grace personified, speaks excellent English, and welcomes every traveller like family. Everything you need is within walking distance - groceries, bakery, mountains, volcano, waterfalls - and La Esperanza is easily accessible by public bus from Quito. We did a daytrip to Otavalo craft market and also to the Centre of the World - enjoying the local buses through the spectacular mountain scenery. There was even a litter of adorable puppies. Well worth a return visit.

We did not find exactly what we were looking for on our trip to La Esperenza, but what found us, I would not trade for the world. We had no aspirations of staying at Casa Aida.  We just stopped there to ask for directions to the Millennial Sacred Valley.  The valley was not what we hoped it was going to be and certainly not what we drove 15 hours to see.  Slightly disappointed, we drove back to Casa Aida to see if they had any accommodations for the evening. From the moment we walked in the door, we were treated like part of the family. The main home was so beautiful.  We stayed in a huge, very comfortable 5 person bungalow in the back yard. I had come down with a very bad flu on the drive up there. The mother made a fire for me in the main house and made me some special herbal/medicine tea.  For the first time in the last 15 hours I started feeling alive again.  She asked us if we wanted to have dinner with them this evening.  We all smile and agree.  The mother puts on her 'sunday's best' clothes and travels two towns over, where she knows they have the freshest best food, to grocery shop for us. It was a 5 course meal she made us!  The next morning she made us the most delicious breakfast. Everything, two meals and a night stay was only 20 dollars per person. When we left, the whole family was giving us hugs and kisses.  They did not want us to leave.  And we did not feel like leaving either.  If you ever find yourself in La Esperenza, you must stay at Casa Aida!…

Casa Aida es un hostal sin lujos pero con mucha calidez. Recibimos una cálida acogida por parte de Aida, quien compartió con nosotros muchas historias y recuerdos. Nos sentimos como en casa. En todo momento fue muy atenta conmigo, mi esposo y nuestra hija de un año y medio. La habitación tenía mucho encanto por los colores de las paredes y muebles. El desayuno fue excelente, Aida está siempre muy pendiente y presta a ayudarte con lo que desees. Finalmente, la ubicación es perfecta para explorar los alrededores: el Imbabura, las lagunas, el valle de la Rinconada o en la vía a Zuleta los asados de cordero!

A place where you feel like a friend more than a guest. Doña Aida has wonderful food and even better stories. Her grandchild Jose is a great guide for hikes in the area.My stay was short, but I would love to come back. :)

direccion: Bolivar 12-101 YRafael Larrea, Ibarra 100150 Ecuador
descripcion: Looking for a place to stay in Ibarra? Then look no further than Hotel Plaza Victoria, a family-friendly hotel that brings the best of Ibarra to your doorstep.Hotel Plaza Victoria offers guests an array of room amenities including a refrigerator, and getting online is possible, as free wifi is available.The hotel offers room service, to make your visit even more pleasant. The property also features a fitness center and free breakfast. Guests arriving by vehicle have access to free parking.When you’re feeling hungry, be sure to check out Olor a Cafe, La Hacienda Cafe Delicatessen, and La Botica Café, which are some cafes that are popular with locals and out-of-towners alike.Best of all, Hotel Plaza Victoria makes it easy to experience many great Ibarra attractions like Artesanias Ecuatorianas and Arte Colonial, which are some popular art galleries.We’re sure you’ll enjoy your stay at Hotel Plaza Victoria as you experience everything Ibarra has to offer.

comentarios.p_comentario: En viaje familiar. Habitación asignada descuidada con el vidrio roto la manija de la ventana rota por tanto la habitación ruidosa. Una sola toalla en habitación matrimonial llave agua del lavamanos floja se movia sin lograr abrirla fácilmente. El comedor en el cuarto piso. No tiene ascensor. Toca cargar en brazos a niños pequeños. Poca cantidad de mesas. Se llena rápidamente. Espere más de treinta minutos para el desayuno en una mesa improvisada en medio del pasillo junto a un espacio similar a una bodega donde estaba arrumado una máquina de hacer ejercicio sillas de plástico y cartones. Finalmente nos cansamos de perder tiempo y no pudimos desayunar a pesar de q ya estaba incluido en el pago de la habitacion. Espero nuestro desayuno les haya servido de provecho. Con tarjeta de crédito es una tarifa en efectivo otra y toca estar pidiendo factura sino no la dan. No recomiendo este lugar por nada. No habríamos pasado por todo esto sí hubiéramos llegado a la ciudad mas temprano. Muy alto el precio para lo que ofrecen y las condiciones en la que está el hotel.…

We stayed 2 nights here on our way to Colombia and had great nights sleep in the very large and comfortable bed. Everything was very clean, nice and new. Good shower too with lots of hot water. Wifi and TV worked well and we liked the breakfast too. Location is perfect and central with walking distance to everything you need, restaurants cafés etc. All friendly staff and  very good value for money.

Si necesitas un sitio para dormir y pasar la noche es una opción aceptale tiene lo básico y es limpio por el precio tampoco se puede exigir más tiene buena ubiacción pero el parqueadero es a una cuadra.

El Hotel queda cerca de la zona céntrica,  incluye desayuno y la vista del comedor es agradable e incluye parqueo abierto y cerrado. Deberían mejorar las duchas debido a que no se pueden poner en un término intermedio entre el agua caliente y frío.

Es un hotel comodo, se encuentra en el centro de la ciudad, yo me quede solamente por una noche, pero presenta todas la comodidades que uno necesita, al estar en el centro de la ciudad genera un poco de incomodidad el ingreso en horarios pico. Si van de un viaje ida por vuelta es una buena opción.

El hotel está ubicado en le centro de la ciudad, pero encontramos varios temas insatisfactorios, no dispone de parqueadero para los vehículos, el que tienen contratado a 200 m finalmente no abrió a mi llegada por lo que tuve que dejar mi vehículo en la calle. Las habitaciones con muy mal gusto en la decoración (mire las fotos), sería poco importante, pero además pedí habitación doble con cama matrimonial y me dieron una con dos camas individuales unidas!!!!!! Lo que dejaba en la mitad un canal incómodo para dormir, además la una cama sonaba incomodando el descanso. El baño tenía un olor desagradable y además lo encontramos sucio. En general la percepción sobre la limpieza del lugar no fue satisfactoria  Lámparas en mal estado una sin pantalla solo con el foco, y para confirmar el mantenimiento deficiente, las sabanas estaban rotas dejando ver lo vetustas que eran.  Finalmente tuvimos una habitación con ventana a una calle muy transitada pro lo que resultaba bulliciosa para el descanso. La administración debería trabajar bastante si quieren cambiar la calidad del hotel, la tarifa pagada de USD 47, inc. impuestos, si bien no es una tarifa alta en el mundo hotelero, resulta excesiva en el balance precio, vs servicio recibido.…

Pésima atención, habitación muy pequeña, mucho ruido, imposible descansar, nada recomendado, hotel muy muy malo para no volver nunca más. Parqueadero lejano del hotel, nivel de limpieza bajo, vengo por negocios manejando muchas horas y me encuentro con este tipo de establecimientos

Pros: -Great customer service (everybody at the front desk is friendly) -Close to restaurants and stores.  Cons: Miniature windows in the room. No elevator. The hotel has stores on the bottom floor so the lobby is on the second floor.  One towel for a family room. No hair conditioner Bad wifi signal Tv looses signal  Miniature trash can  No good for families with young kids. The Parking lot is located a block away from the hotel.

Si vienes de visita a Ibarra este hotel es perfecto, esta en pleno centro en un barrio tranquilo a pocas cuadras de parques iglesias sitios turísticos todo a pocos pasos, las habitaciones son cómodas y limpias el personal amable y el precio muy conveniente, recomendado.

I stayed at Plaza Victoria last week for 5 days because of my job. My first impression was good when I looked everything was new and shiny. Then the person at the front desk didn't have the best of the attitudes. Totally loved my room, with a big queen size bed and nice sheets, but the bathroom isn't so nice and had a funny smell. The room rate included everyday breakfast but the first day couldn't had it because they weren't going to have it ready until 8am. And here comes the main reason why I wouldn't go back to this hotel... On the second night I was going to shave and for that I bought a new spare for my shaving machine, and guess what... It was used by someone else, so I went to the front desk and explain this to a very helpful guy. Next day I spoke to the Hotel Manager and he seemed exceptic about all this and he agreed on replace my spare blade for a new one. I stayed there for the rest but kept everything on my suitcase. So the hotel has a great location, the price is not bad, another downside is that the bedrooms facing the Main Street are too loud. Hopefully my experience won't repeat to anyone else and I'm sure they can serve much better to their future guests  Regards…

direccion: Ave. Mariano Acosta 1638 And Cristobal Gomez Jurado, Ibarra 100150 Ecuador
descripcion: Hotel Ajavi is an excellent choice for travelers visiting Ibarra, offering a family-friendly environment alongside many helpful amenities designed to enhance your stay.Hotel Ajavi features room service and a concierge, to help make your stay more enjoyable. The property also boasts a pool and free breakfast. If you are driving to Hotel Ajavi, free parking is available.If you’re looking for a barbeque restaurant, consider a visit to Chamuyando, Ibérica Ribs, or La Parrilla del Tio Jessy, which are all conveniently located a short distance from Hotel Ajavi.Enjoy your stay in Ibarra!

comentarios.p_comentario: Pésimo servicio!!! El personal es maleducado y groseros. En el baño público de la cafetería no hay papel. La cafetería dice que cierra a las 22:00 pero a las 21:00 ya no quisieron atender. No pudieron dar opciones de donde conseguir comida.

Buena ubicacion, cerca de un centro comercial y lugares para comer, habitacion muy comoda y amplia, desayuno buffet de buena calidad, excelente atencion, con parqueadero propio, precio razonable para la ofreta del area.

Spent here one night with a friend in late December 2021. Very nice and clean hotel, breakfast also nice – although we came late and it was almost finished. But excellent fruits were still there. And the coffee was super strong, just right for us.

Hotel Ajavi is a great choice for travelers visiting Ibarra, as it offers a family-friendly environment, as well as numerous services designed to enhance your stay. This hotel offers free wifi, hot water, cable TV and more services that are available to the client.  Hotel Ajavi has a concierge and room service to make your stay more pleasant and safe. The property also has a swimming pool and also includes breakfast. If you are driving to Hotel Ajavi, free parking is available. The people who work here are very friendly. Also if you are looking for restaurants, there are many of these that are very close to Hotel Ajavi. There are also many places you can visit, also not far from Hotel Ajavi. If you visit Ibarra I recommend it.

The hotel has new and old rooms, we were in a new, spacious and comfortable room, the facilities generally good however you see that they are old, the breakfast varied and good taste.  The pool area is seen to be renovated however it needs a better cleaning of the pool water.  The location is good, it is close to the city center by taxi 5 min.  The cost is high in campared to the quality and rating of the hotel.

Es un muy buen hotel. Esta casi completo, tiene hidromasaje, piscina, gimnasio, sala de juegos, turco y sauna. Las habitaciones muy confortables y limpias. El desayuno es Buffet aunque no hay mucha variedad es muy bueno.  Tiene tarjeta para ingresar a las habitaciones no llaves. Me gustó mucho el lugar aunq aún el precio es un poco alto $$ pero si lo vale.

Durante el pasado mes de abril del presente año 2019, fue organizado un evento académico internacional en las instalaciones del hotel Ajaví. Espacio confortable y acústico con ingreso dual, parqueadero disponible y sanitarios debidamente aseados. Es una opción válida y afrontable con cálida atención de sus anfitriones. Realizar cualquier otro evento que se desee celebrar, constituye una alternativa de singular consideración.

El día de hoy 6 de Junio fuimos a reservar habitaciones para los asistentes a un evento que se realizará en la ciudad de Ibarra en el mes de Julio. Lamentablemente la atención por parte de la recepcionista fue  de lo peor que pudimos recibir. Un hotel sencillo, bonito, en remodelación,  pero lamentablemente con el peor servicio. Hay mejores opciones en la ciudad de Ibarra.

This traditional, remodelled hotel has all the current comfort you are looking for, either to visit nearby sites or on a business trip. I stayed there on a busines trip and really got all the comfort I was looking for to get rest for my next hard working day. It has got beautiful gardens, a pool and a dely, where you can go for coffee and a sandwich. If you wish to stroll around, it is nearby shopping centers and supermarkets, as well as nice restaurants.

Had to wait 30 minutes for hot water. Room was clean, bed was ok. Food ok but was sick after eating their egg soup. Wait staff mostly pleasant. Large group came in our last 2 nights, very loud until 3 am no regard for others

direccion: Zuleta, Ibarra 100150 Ecuador
descripcion: Located in the Province of Imbabura, in The Valley of Zuleta, possibly the most beautiful area of the Northern zone of Ecuador; it is only 100 Km North of Quito. The Hacienda remains with all its traditions, respecting their historical and cultural identity. A unique opportunity for those who like to explore one of the best breeding sites of the spanish horse, fighting bulls, and dairy.

comentarios.p_comentario: I stayed recently at Hacienda La Merced Baja in 4.2021. It is a working ranch with Andalusian horses and cattle. there are hiking trails and the town nearby is famous for its embroidery and wood working. The rooms are very spacious. Bed is very comfortable and bathroom are clean and perfect size. But what you really get there is a sense of history and a family that loves what it does and how well they do it. They are so warm and gracious.  The food is absolutely amazing. I rode with RideAndes.com - Sally Vergette, and had a great day of riding before we set out into more remote places. Stay at this Hacienda. They are accepting reservations no matter what the Trip Advisor says. I cannot wait to go back there.

Tuvimos un lindo paseo familiar, rodeados de hermosos paisajes, los dueños estupendos anfitriones y la comida deliciosa de su chef español, no tuvimos oportunidad de pasar la noche pero nos gustaría hacerlo porque las habitaciones se veían muy acogedoras. Totalmente recomendable.

Muchas gracias a los dueños Diana y Oswaldo por hacer nuestra estadía fabulosa. La hacienda es divina con unos paisajes espectaculares, criadero de caballos españoles, pudimos ver el ordeño, venados, conocimos a Paco un torete que se pasea por la hacienda como mascota, senderos para caminar y tuvimos la suerte de ver un cóndor. La comida estuvo deliciosa, realmente nos sentimos en nuestra casa, esperamos regresar pronto Muchas Gracias !!!

Mi marido y yo encontramos esta joya de una hacienda cuando fuimos en coche a través Zuleta el verano pasado.  Estábamos buscando un lugar para almorzar, pero muchos lugares estaban cerrados (era un día laborable).    Cuando conducimos a través de la puerta de la Hacienda La Merced Baja, vimos a un joven y su padre en un camion.  Era una granja ocupada.  Siendo extranjeros temerarios, preguntamos, "¿Sirven el almuerzo?"  El joven pareció sorprendido, pero luego, su madre, Diana, vino a saludarnos y nos dijo volver en una hora, en inglés excelente.  Cuando volvimos, un almuerzo de tres cursos deliciosos, todos hecho por la madre, nos esperaba.  Además, la limonada casera era la mejor que hemos probado.    Antes y después de la comida, el padre, Oswaldo, nos dio un tour de la hacienda.  Nos mostró sus hermosas caballos andaluces, el toro joven, la plaza de tientas, la capilla, el museo arqueológica, las habitaciones, y la sala de trofeos, decorada de muchos premios que ganó con sus caballos.  Nos explicó la historia de la hacienda y escuchamos con gran interés.    Nos sentíamos como invitados muy especiales de la familia.  No nos quedamos la noche, pero sii volvemos a Quito, Ecuador, sin duda nos gustaría quedarnos en esta hacienda.  No podemos encontrar a la gente más hospitalaria que Diana y Oswaldo.    My husband and I stumbled upon this gem of a hacienda when we were driving through Zuleta in search of a place to have lunch.  Many places were closed (maybe because it was a weekday).    When we drove through the gate of the hacienda, we saw a young man and his father in a truck.  It was a busy farm.  Being brash foreigners, we asked, "Do you serve lunch?" The young man looked surprised, but later his mother Diana greeted us and told us to come back in one hour in excellent English.    When we came back, a delicious three-course lunch awaited us, all made by the mother.  What's more, the home-made lemonade was the best we've ever tasted!  Before and after lunch, the father Oswaldo gave us a tour of the hacienda.  He showed us their beautiful Spanish horses, a young bull, a training ring for bulls, the chapel, pre-Columbian archeological collection, the guest rooms and a trophy room, decorated with many prizes he won with his horses.  He explained the history of the hacienda, and we listened with great interest.    We really felt like special guests of the family.  We did not spend the night, but If we ever return to Quito, we would definitely like to stay in this hacienda.  One cannot meet more hospitable people than Diana and Oswaldo.    .…

This is a beautiful hacienda which has maintained its character and style and where you can experience the Ecuadorian highlands and its beautiful landscapes and learn about life in a colonial hacienda. The rooms are very comfortable, we were served traditional local cuisine which was delicious and we experienced a very friendly and personalized service. We particularly enjoyed horseback riding, they have amazing Spanish horses! Its proximity to several tourist attractions in the Imbabura province makes it an ideal choice for travelers.

Desconectarse del trajín de la vida diaria, es posible cuando se viaja a la Hacienda La Merced Baja. Sus montañas y paisajes, son solo un pequeño complemento de la experiencia integral que se tiene al pasar allí; poder vivenciar una hacienda aun en completo funcionamiento, su ordeño, caballos españoles, venados, gansos y conejos, hacen de este un espacio mágico; hay que agregar que la comida es deliciosa y la hospitalidad de Diana, Oswaldo y sus hijos maravillosa.

We chose to stay here for family reasons and we're thrilled with the people, the place and their attitude towards residents.  A beautiful olden style hacienda with an open fire in the lounge of the suite we stayed in. The hacienda is famous for its exquisite pure bred Andalusian horses, its dairy herd and its warm welcome and traditional Fayre.  We ate in the dining room which was blessed with a wood burner to keep you toasty when you are eating because in the evening it does tend to get considerably colder than during the day. Beautiful views of the snow covered Cayambe mountain can be seen in the morning by walking a couple of hundred yards through the farm the estate.  What a wonderful idyllic setting, we will be back!

My family enjoyed two days at Hacienda La Merced Baja.  We were a party of 9 and loved the 4 rooms ; each room was unique and very cozy.  We felt like living in the colonial era.  The food was also amazing.  At night we had a Ecuadorean cousine dinner at their main room fire place. The owners of the Hacienda treated us like family .  You can visit the milking farm and go horseback riding. We also visited the prehistoric museum were they had pieces found under their Hacienda from ancient civilizations , small chapel and a small bullring.

We spent 5 days at the Hacienda with the whole family (my husband and I, plus our two kids who were ages 8 and 11 at the time), and all of us had a really wonderful experience there.    We started our trip by spending 8 days in the Galapagos Islands. La Hacienda felt like the perfect post- (or pre-) Galapagos trip, allowing us to experience a really authentic Ecuadoran dairy farm.     Diana arranged to have one of her employees pick us up at our hotel in Quito and transport us to the Hacienda. He was friendly, on time, and the drive was pleasant.  Once at the Hacienda, Diana and her husband Osvaldo took great care of us personally.  Diana speaks great English (her mother is an English speaker); and Osvaldo was extremely hospitable, going out of his way to answer our many questions about the daily life running a farm.    Osvaldo and/or his (grown) children took my daughter and husband out on rides each day. Both of them have been taking riding lessons, but are not especially experienced.  They both raved about the beauty of the trails, with climbs into the mountains and through rivers, and with incredible views. The horses were gorgeous, fit and well-trained.  La Hacienda breeds and sells Spanish horses, so they have a wonderful selection of gorgeous mounts.  Diana took us on expeditions each day, to various parts of Ibarra.  We saw markets, went hiking, and explored the culture and natural beauty of the area with her.  She was always a gracious, knowledgeable and friendly guide. We were as busy as we cared to be, ensuring we still had plenty of down-time for reading and relaxation.  The kids also get to see the daily routine of running the farm, including the milking operation; along with playing with baby goats, the working dogs and many other animals which are part of life on the farm.    The accommodations were also very comfortable, and made us feel part of life on the farm, and are as authentic as the rest of the farm.  For example there was a fire built for us each night in our fireplace, which kept the room warm without the need for electric or gas heat.  It was very cosy.   Lastly, we were served home cooked meals each day. The food was delicious, and all of us ate well and enjoyed it (even my 8 year-old son).    If you are looking for a 5-star luxury "dude ranch" this is not your place; but if you want a really comfortable and quality experience that feels really personal and authentic, you couldn't ask for anything better.  Thank you Diana and Osvaldo!  We will remember this trip fondly for a lifetime.…

La Merced Baja is a wonderful weekend escape from Quito or for travelers who seek a true Hacienda experience near Otavalo. The owners welcome their guests just as members of the family and one feels at home and in good hands immediately! The surrounding nature is stunning and is perfect for long rides on the beautiful Spanish-bred horses who live at La Merced. Thank you for 2 wonderful days!

direccion: San Luis de Caranqui, Ibarra 100132 Ecuador

comentarios.p_comentario: No recomiendo este lugar ya que en realidad es una piscina pública sin ningun control de aforo que cobran 5/10 dólares a cualquier visitante externo  Con lo cual los huéspedes no tenemos ni seguridad ya qué pasa la puerta abierta a todo público sin control hasta las 10 pm  No hay agua caliente en la noche en las habitaciones  El desayuno es muy básico  Y sobre todo deberían presentarse como piscina a publica con habitaciones para que los huéspedes sepan a qué se atienen en su alojamiento  El internet nunca funcionó  La actitud hacia nuestro reclamo fue simplemente necesitamos obtener más recursos en los feriados para mantener la Hosteria  Lo más rescatable de todo fue la señora que nos atendió en la cena / excelente muy amable lo único rescatable

Située au dessus d'Ibarra, cette "communauté" regroupe 301 foyers qui entendent se développer économiquement tout en continuant à vivre selon les traditions. Une vingtaine de ces familles accueillent des touristes et leur font partager pendant quelques jours leur mode de vie. Cette activité, liée à la vente de produits locaux tels que miel, broderies, etc.permet aux familles de moins dépendre des seuls produits de la terre. L'accueil y est simple et chaleureux, les touristes étant véritablement traités en amis et non pas en clients. nb. L'alcool et le tabac sont bannis de la Communauté San Clemlente. Les familles sont bilingues, espagnol et Quechua Vivement recommandé !

So, we decided to stay here the night before climbing Imbabura. It was the perfect decision. It is a great stay in Esperanza. We had a great night rest in a huge King bed, great dinner, pool to relax, and great service. I highly recommend staying here.

Estuvimos por una noche, el lugar es muy calido, ameno, tranquilo, silencioso, perfecto para descansar... las habitaciones amplias con television por cable, chimenea, mi bar, mini sala y baño privado... la zona humeda con piscina temperada, sauna, turco, hidromasajes, bar a la piscina... canchas deportivas... el único pero fue el wifi que presentaba inconsistencia... el precio de 40 por noche que incluía el desayunos estilo americano con varias opciones de huevos, jugos y cafés... en fin... quede gratamente satisfecho... se los recomiendo ya sea en família,  amigos y/o parejas... por cierto ésta retirado a pocos minutos de la ciudad  con una vista de altura muy bonita... un lugar ideal para desconectarse de la ciudas

Grata sorpresa Chimenea, todas las comodidades, una excelente y amplia zona húmeda y piscina, la comida muy buena en su relación calidad precio, el sitio excelente pues no es en medio de la ciudad, espectacular en resumen

Overlooking the valley of Ibarra and the whole city on the one side and underneath the volcano Imbabura on the other, the view is simply superb. The swimming pool is huge and heated. The rooms are large and each one has a fire place. Internet worked well too. The place is hard to find if you don't have Waze as there is no sign for it and it's located well outside the city. We did miss having bar/restaurant open in the evening but I suppose this will be fixed once more staff is hired as the place had just recently started operating as a hotel when we stayed there. We payed $40 per head including taxes and breakfast. Kids pay half that price.

Excelente atención y trató de parte de su personal. Siempre atentos. Disfrutamos mucho de la chimenea en la habitación y de la piscina que es muy temperada.... la comida tb excelente.... recomendado para quien quiera pasar un fin de semana en familia.... disfrutar la naturaleza en una zona urbano rural del norte del país....

Muy bien ubicado, un trato excepcional, muy buena experiencia en el hotel. La gente muy bien educada y los trabajadores de el hotel brindan una atención de primera. Un lugar de obligada visita en Ecuador, lo recomiendo para todos.

Gran lugar, espacioso, maravillosa atención, buen clima, lindo paisaje ...vale la pena! Como familia es un lugar ideal para el descanso, seguro sobre todo para los niños, en el que pueden relajarse y los padres igual.

Excelentes habitaciones, cómodas y acogedoras. La comida deliciosa y el servicio de calidad. Un gran lugar para descansar un fin de semana. Está cerca de Quito pero lejos del ruido de la ciudad. Todo estuvo perfecto!

direccion: Panamericana km 4. 5, Ibarra 100150 Ecuador
descripcion: ACCOMODATIONS: 50 Rooms with modern bathrooms, 13 of our rooms have chimneys, 23 of our rooms have DirecTV• RESTAURANT SERVICE: National & International Cuisine with ample wine selection • ENTRETAINMENTE every Saturday during lunch hours we have live music and folkloric dances, Indian choreographies with authentic and colorful costumes.• Movie and Karaoke lounge Pool table, darts and fusball, family roomReading areas with peaceful and beautiful scenes• INTERNET SERVICE: Wi-Fi available in all rooms and all areas of the Hacienda• BUSINESS CENTER • SPA

comentarios.p_comentario: Grand confort malgré l'altitude, grâce à une délicieuse bouillotte ; vraiment parfait. Repas et petit déjeuner copieux. Grand silence en pleine nature. Très bon accueil à la réception Grande sérénité des lieux

La Hacienda - Hosteria Chorlavi es simplemente fantástica! La mejor atención y servicio al cliente la puede uno disfrutar desde inicio a fin, absolutamente recomendada! La comida, las habitaciones y los amenities en general, mas un clima privilegiado y una ubicación estratégica, hacen de este lugar un "must" para viajes de placer o negocios!

Muy lindas instalaciones yo me iba a quedar 1 noche solamente y en esa noche el.jacuzzi estaba frio y el sauna un poco sucio, no se pudo disfrutar las áreas humedas, deberían estar listas a toda hora todos los días

Es una hostería muy bonita, con actividades para niños y estupenda comida, cercana a sitios turísticos, con lindos jardines y un ambiente familiar, piscina, spa, gimnasio, canchas y precios adecuados  al establecimiento.

La comida es muy buena se recomienda el locro de papa lo sirven bien caliente y en plato de barro. Las instalaciones son amplias y limpias, con áreas verdes para caminar y disfrutar de la naturaleza. La Hacienda que tiene su historia y puedes conocerla a mas profundidad visitando su salón de memorias... Recomedado!!!

Staying in Hacienda Chorlavi was definitely one of our best stops in Ecuador, from the moment we arrived (with a kind offer from the hacienda to arrange us a transport) to the very last moment. The place is absolutely beautiful, surrounded with nature, a beautiful light and decoration, wisdom in each corner and lots of love and attentive gestures from the staff— adding to the food variety and quality, there are many beautiful thoughts and prompts spread around the place.  The rooms are very spacious as well as comfortable and well decorated. Besides all these beautiful elements, the Hacienda offers a lot of different options and opportunities one can entertain himself with. All of this combined, creating a very personal and wholesome environment.  It was an amazing opportunity to come and stay, relax, as well as engage with the culture of Ibarra. We can’t wait to be back. Thank you so much!  Carmo y Carolina…

Es un hermoso lugar para compartir con la familia tanto grandes como chicos, a pesar que nunca vimos la presentación folklórica que ofrecían, hay muchas actividades por hacer. El desayuno delicioso buena atención.

Buen servicio,  habitación limpia y reconfortante para la noche, buena opción que coloquen bolsas de agua caliente antes de dormir eso ayudo mucho a mejorar la expericiencia, lo que compaginaba con el trinar de los pájaros y el sonido de la lluvia.

No es ningún lugar de lujo pero es muy cómodo y el personal es muy amable. Había muy pocos huéspedes por la pandemia así que el restaurante estaba cerrado para la cena y no había opciones cerca para cenar, pero por las molestias me ofrecieron un cuarto mejor al que tenía reservado. Eso se aprecia mucho. Me tocó una habitación muy amplia y cómoda. Quizá las instalaciones podrían renovarse pero a la vez que sean un poco antiguas le da cierto encanto. El desayuno me pareció excelente. Sí lo recomiendo.

It is a sweet, quaint property, but I could hear cars from my room while sleeping. However, I am sure that there are quiet rooms. It seemed that there was some construction and most of the property was vacant (probably due to covid). The property is a bit outside of Ibarra. The breakfast was lovely, and the staff was super friendly.   The room and bathroom are elementary but perfectly comfortable. The bed was only okay, but I was not expecting anything fantastic.   If I find myself in Ibarra again, I will stay here!

direccion: Llano Grande - Sector Piman Principal, Ibarra 100150 Ecuador

comentarios.p_comentario: Ein wirklich schönes Hotel um Zeit mit der Familie zu verbringen und sich zu entspannen. Tolle Anlage mit beheiztem Pool und Whirlpool. Wir hatten sehr schönes Wetter und konnten den Tag am Pool voll genießen. Sehr gutes Essen und ein sehr sehr aufmerksamer und freundlicher Service, der uns viele Extrawünsche gerne erfüllt hat.

Un lugar mágico. Espectacular para celebrar nuestro aniversario. Tienen el ritual de los candados para sellar tu amor. La comida deliciosa, el lugar impecable, la atención de primera calidad de hecho nos dieron una sorpresa por nuestro aniversario (una cena especial con cócteles y todo) el clima riquísimo. Todo todo genial. Totalmente recomendado 😃

Un ambiente romántico que envolvió nuestro aniversario matrimonial número cincuenta con paisajes únicos y compromisos de amor  en sus rincones. La posibilidad de caminar en sus campos, cabalgar en sus senderos, nadar en la piscina, disfrutar de una selecta oferta gastronómica, y al final del día descansar en sus cómodas cabañas, luego de un masaje total de sus profesionales y llegar a la cómoda cama con  el calor y confort del hidromasaje. Es una experiencia muy enriquecedora y placentera .

Mala experiencia, la verdad es muy caro para las cosas q ofrecen y encima las instalaciones no son top como para pagar tanto, en mi caso reserve una habitavion con jacuzzi , que a la final ese jacuzzi no me sirvio para nada y entre la habitacion sin jacuzzi y esa existia una diferencia casi de 40 dolares ojo y la verdad el jacuzzi no sirvio, encima tenia problemas en la bañera con el agua caliente no se calentaba el calefon( terrible q en un hotel asi manejen el ahua caliente con calefon para cada habitacion) terrible, en cuanto a la limpieza de la habitacion pesimo el y pequeños detalles de decoración que la verdad no era como para pagar como 260 dolares una noche,  terrible me parece exageradamente caro.Las actividades com costo me parecen carisimas para lo que hacen, ese paseo en carreta para ver un terreno de tunas 12 dolares x persona es demasiado caro. En cuanto a la comida si estaba buena pero necesita mas variedad y algo importante claramente deben especificar en la carta que toooodas las bebidas y comidas es MAS IVA Y MAS SERVICIO, porque claro en la carta aparentemente no se ve tan cara la comida pero claro cuando ya sales y pagas la cuenta te llevas la megasorpresa que te cobran el valor del servicio y la verdad el servicio pésimo para lo q se paga me parece carisimo. Otro punto que a los empleados del hotel si es cierto claro tienen q ofertar lo q ofrece el hotel pero si deben considdrar en decirles q no presionen tanto a los huéspedes en adquirir los paseos en esas carretas q me parecen carisimas por una ctividad tan simple y encima molesta muchisimo al.huesped pareciera q cobran comision por ofertar esas actividades.  Otro problema que cuando llegue , el jacuzzi infinito como lo llaman , estaba lleno pero mencionaban q nonestaba funcionando. Oseaaaaaaa !!! Perdido un dia sin usar esa vaina y uno paga tanto pensando q lo va a poder usar , encima hay q reservar, no no terrible me parecio eso.  En resumen me parecio carisimo lo q pague la verdad el lugar lo unico bonito la piscina pero me parece q es un balneario mas y no como lo publicitan algo exuberantemente top, con lo que pague tranquilimante me hospedaba en el marriot y me tratan como rey y hasta me sobraba plata. En fin señores #TUNASYCABRASNORECOMENDADO …

Mi tercera visita a este hermoso lugar. Destaco en esta última, la nueva carta y sabores estupendos del restaurante. Una combinación muy bien lograda, sabores deliciosos y precio adecuado.  Con este cambio la experiencia mejoró muchísimo en relación a mi anterior visita.  El personal es lo máximo! Todos tienen una gran predisposición de servicio.

Fue le experiencia más hermosa junto a mi esposa celebramos nuestro primer aniversario la amabilidad de la gente, desde la entrada hace que el lugar sea mágico sus instalaciones son hermosas un lugar totalmente alejado de todo para descansar y pasar en pareja ...Volveremos sin dudarlo .. Gracias por hacer nuestro aniversario el mejor!!! #TunasyCabras

Tunas y cabras en realidad es un paraíso para disfrutar, mi grupo de amigos y yo buscábamos alejarnos de multitud y lo mismo de siempre. Las instalaciones muy cómodas, lo rústico de las habitaciones y el exelente servicio hicieron que a cada minuto me sintiera como en casa. La comida y los cócteles son exelentes, seguro regresamos varias, por lo bien que nos fue en nuestra aventura al hotel. Felicitaciones espero verles pronto......

Fuimos con toda mi familia, y realmente el lugar caro para lo que ofrece.  Nos habían ofrecido una noche gratis y cuando llegamos las habitaciones estaban sucias, y lo que nos mencionó el chico fue “ustedes pagaron por la habitación estándar” a pesar de que eso no es una respuesta.  Nos cambiaron de cuartos pero igual seguían sucios debajo de las camas. Los baños de las habitaciones súper chiquitos. Se regaba el agua por debajo de la ducha.   En el lugar no hay nada que hacer aparte de la piscina y el spa.   La comida es buena, pero le falta variedad.  La verdad no volvería, es muy caro para lo que ofrecen.

Greetings to all,   My partner and I admire all the features that Tunas y Cabras Hotel has to offer. However, we expected more from them now that we tried to get our money back due to the Ecuadorian CoVid protocols that were established this past week. I was attended by “Maritza” and she even assured my partner and I we would get our money back guaranteed due to this delicate matter. Two weeks have gone by and I have received not one invoice?! I had to even take time off of work just to reinsure they were going to help but I was sadly mistaken . This is not the way to leave a good impression to the Ecuadorian people, let alone tourists. I’ve visited many places around the world and not one hotel has given me an issue regarding a reimbursement. It’s sad to say, but I and my partner do not recommend an establishment who do not stick to there word. Furthermore , WE WANT OUR MONEY BACK .  After clarifying that we can not accept any further discounts (which aren’t really discounts) , they tell us we do not qualify in our entitled money back. WE ARE LIVING IN A PANDEMIC , WHAT MAKES YOU THINK WE ARENT ENTITLED FOR OUR OWN HARD WORKED CASH. ITS NOT OUR FAULT ECUADOR IS IN LOCKDOWN AND WE CAN NOT DRIVE TO WHERE YOU ARE LOCATED . HOW DISGRACEFUL.…

It is surprising that this place has 4 stars, actually because of everything I experienced, the place is super good to organize a party in the neighborhood. To begin with, the logistics of the place didn't  allow me to extend my booking due to problems that they couldn't explain. In addition, the service is good but not acceptable in a place of this price because most of the service staff is from "interns" who do their internships at the place. Besides, the room is big but it is not spectacular, it was dirty with cockroaches and without water in the shower. they did not give us bathrobes to move from the pool to the room. They have nothing in mind for flies, it is surprising how many flies there are and how many bites they can give you. The best advice for this is to bring repellent. You will see tons of flies once you reach the front desk, believe me. The only think I enjoyed was Dilan's company during the barn visit. The landscape is also nice, it is worthy.…

direccion: Calle 24 de Septiembre S 2-389 Conector Alpachaca, Quito 170907 Ecuador
descripcion: Eb Hotel By Eurobuilding Quito Airport, is the second installment of the EB brand from the Eurobuilding Hotels chain, which is known providing a 5-star service and a luxury design experience throughout all of its 9 properties, located throughout Venezuela, Argentina and the United States. EB Hotel is open Since Octuber 2017. The EB Hotel is located just 8 minutes away from the new Mariscal Sucre International Airport in Quito at the area of Tababela, Metropolitan District of Quito. We are close to the different locations preferred by visitors, 30 minutes away from the city’s historic center and other tourist attractions such as the Andean mountain range, the Cotopaxi volcano and 20 minutes away from the center of the world. Other beautiful landscapes, like the Quilatoa volcano, are easily accessed as well. The hotel has been specially designed for business travelers, tourists and families in general, offering comfort, service and spaces that will inspire you and make your stay a pleasant experience.

comentarios.p_comentario: Excelente el hotel es hermoso sus habitaciones muy acogedoras,  la piscina deliciosa y su personal es excelente la atención que nos dan como huéspedes es muy agradable y te sientes en casa lo recomiendo 1000%

Fantastic hotel, with a beautiful decor, rooms very comfortable, magic beds, and the most important the people. Everybody on the hotel it’s always ready to help to make your stay much more comfortable that you could spect. By far my best estoy in Quito metropolitan area.

Eb Hotel is a wonderfully modern hotel with excellent service! Convenient to the Quito airport and a nice resting spot before or after any visit to the Galapagos. While not located in the Old Town, it is only a 1/2 hour ride away. They also provided transportation to the airport.

Como siempre excelente la estadia, muy confortable, se siente como en casa. El servicio más que excelente, el personal muy amable, en el top es el # 1 de los hoteles que he vistitado. Muy muy recomendado.

Each time I stay at EB I have a superb experience. The staff were very attentive and treated me very well. If you are looking for a quiet, comfortable  and beautiful hotel. EB should be your first choice.

@EurobuildingQuito un lugar muy acogedor , Limpio en su totalidad , me encanto todo , las áreas externas super lindas , respiras aire puro , las habitaciones super Relajantes y comodas , su personal super cordiales y amables . Un saludo a los chicos del área de recepción por tan gentil trato .  Quiero resaltar el área del servicio del restaurante  Sus platillos exquisitos y muy buena atención .  Felicidades   Y agradecerle a los que desde la llegada al restaurante mostraron una  cálida bienvenida.  Los chicos Euvi , Freddy y  Daniela , Gracias por todo y por mostrarse tan servicial en todo momento. Gracias , espero volver algún otro día

This hotel is our new favorite when flying in or out of Quito.  Their shuttle service is great and was there to greet us even though our flight time had changed.  They have helped us with 'early check-in and late check-out requests.  The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful.  The rooms are very nice and comfy and the breakfasts are great.   Looking forward to coming back soon on our next trip. We can highly recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Hotel with a great location if you search a short stay in Quito. If you are traveling on business, this is the perfect hotel for you. Staff is very accommodating and attentive. In addition, facilities are excellent.

Siempre es una maravillosa experiencia. Nos hemos alojado unas tres veces ya en este hotel, siempre con amigos y familia. La verdad lo hemos hecho para escapar de la rutina de Quito y por disfrutar un poco la piscina y el buen clima de Tababela.   La comida del restaurante es muy buena, el servicio del personal también.  Definitivamente es un lugar al que siempre que podamos volveremos.

Spectacular hotel.  Everything was very clean.  The front desk went out of their way to be helpful. They stored my bags several times while I did multi-day tours in other places.  The room was large and very comfortable.  Security was great,  you needed a key to go up the elevators to the rooms.  The restaurant had good food.  The gym was well equipped and clean.  The spa was great.  This is the only place that I will stay when I'm in Quito.

direccion: Venezuela N8-26 y Manabi, Quito 170150 Ecuador
descripcion: Located in a restored colonial house of the 18th century, in the heart of the Historic Center of Quito 100 meters from the Sucre Theater, 200 meters from the Basilica and the presidential palace, close to all the tourist places of interest, monuments, squares, convents, churches and museums. It offers elegant and comfortable rooms with fixed internet connection and free Wi-Fi, telephone, satellite TV, heating, safety box and private bathroom with hot shower, hair dryer. Each room is unique, since they are decorated with different murals hand painted by artists from the Quito school of each church in Quito, the hotel has a classic decoration and furniture of colonial style in wood. Our guests can spend relaxing moments in our two patios, having a delicious breakfast with fresh fruit, or reading a book next to a beautiful vertical garden with a waterfall, from our viewpoint you can enjoy a 360 degree view of the entire center historical or visit our craft store.

direccion: Jose De Antepara E3 61 Y Vicente Leon Vincente Leon, Quito 170136 Ecuador
descripcion: This unique colonial building was restored with great care by re-integrating the original building elements such as the original windows, doors, handles, etc. The use of paint techniques, unique colours and vintage elements give the whole a breathtaking appearance but at the same time radiate a sense of tranquillity. You can look around for hours and enjoy the many details and ingenious elements, unique and different in each flat. The highly personalised approach of the staff makes your stay very special. Their advice on local experiences, tasting unique dishes or discovering lesser-known tourist places is why Old Town Quito Suites is one of the most chosen hotels in Quito.

comentarios.p_comentario: This boutique hotel is a gem. It is located in Old Town Quito, in a nicely renovated old building, the kind that made Quito the first UNESCO designated World Cultural Heritage Site. The owner is a Belgian expat with background in hospitality business and you can see the result starting with the aesthetic of the property. He lives on site and runs a tight ship. The staff  is great, polite and responsive. They have also helped us arrange our airport transfers and day trips with private guides. We had a large unit with two bedrooms, living room, dining area and kitchen. We did not use it for anything but breakfast that was provided by the property. It was very convenient to get it out of the way before starting our tours at 8 AM.

I meant to write this review as soon as I returned from Ecuador but here I am 8 months later just now getting around to it. And I'm glad I waited. I've been out of the country  a couple more times since this trip and I have to say every other hotel I've been to since has been a huge disappointment. Don't get me wrong, they were all nice enough hotels and I had no complaints. But Old Town Quito Suites is special.  We only stayed for 3 nights but I really felt like Dirk became a good friend in those few days. He was so welcoming and full of great advice on check in and kept it up throughout our stay. The room was fully stocked with high-end toiletries, linens, and even some food in the refrigerator. On our third day, we met up with some other guests from the hotel along with Dirk and walked to a local artist's studio to view his work and talk to him. Days always started with fresh pastries delivered personally by Dirk. Aside from great accommodations, I felt like I received a stay I wouldn't have received anywhere else.   It was a great few days and quite honestly I would have moved into this hotel given the chance. Easily the best hotel experience I've had anywhere in the world.…

My husband and I travel very often but were in Quito first time the entire last week. We were extremely lucky that I found this place, Old Town Quito Suites.  We loved it!  Very thoughtfully and tastefully designed apartment!  The unit was fully equipped and extremely clean. The cleaning, breakfast, fresh fruit and drinking water was provided daily. The wi-fi was speedy and the TV had many streaming options including the US channels. Great host, amazing hotel staff, from the owner to the cleaners, COMMUNICATION A+. This place was created and is being managed with excellence!  The location is very convenient, walking distance to everything you need to see and, on a street, lined up with cafes, relaxed great food restaurants, including a great low-cost massage place. We were getting our massages almost daily.  The best apartment we have ever had while traveling, and we've been all over Europe, South and North America!…

We had a wonderful visit. Excellent and charming accommodations, central location, thoughtful/helpful appointments in the room like fresh bread and eggs daily, but what makes it truly outstanding is the staff. Jhon, Joz and the rest of the team are kind, thoughtful and so helpful with anything one might need like tourism suggestions, car and excursion bookings, etc. They truly helped us feel like it was a home away from home.

We loved this hotel! We stayed multiple nights during our trip in Ecuador. The staff were top-notch, accommodating, welcoming, and very helpful. They offered suggestions on restaurants and called taxis when needed. We felt very welcomed here. In fact, it was our son's 13th birthday, and they stopped by with balloons and chocolate croissants! It made his day EXTRA special and we even brought the balloons home. What a memory! Our family of four stayed in 2 different rooms over the course of our trip (The Attic and Room with a View) and we loved both! Plenty of space, gorgeous décor, and such a wonderful comfortable and luxurious apartment feel. The food items, warm bread, roomy accommodations, full kitchen, nice bathroom, quietness, and nearness to Old Town sites make this a wonderful place to stay in Quito. Highly recommend.…

Possibly one of the greatest stays I have ever had while traveling, and I've been all over Europe and Asia staying in 4/5 star as well as houseboats in Amsterdam.  Old Town Quito Suites is very central to all of the Old Town sites worth seeing.  Public transportation is ample and the Uber/taxi options widely available.  Dirk (owner), Jhon, Joz and Edison were on top of every single aspect of our stay (from airport pick-up/drop-off) and nothing was too odd to ask for or request denied, and were amazing hosts.  The housekeeping staff was excellent and welcoming and the room was immaculate every time we returned from being out.  The breakfast offerings every morning were ample for us and local restaurants abundant, as well as UberEats being available. (Get a pizza across the street at Pizzeria Boschetti, you will not be disappointed.)  I have already booked for next fall as we have fallen deeply in love with Quito and Old Town Quito Suites.…

Well-appointed rooms with good selection of in-room breakfast items and ample bottled water. Staff was super friendly and helpful in arranging local transportation and making other recommendations. Quiet location but walkable to restaurants, parks, and local attractions.

This was the nicest hotel I’ve ever stayed at and very affordable. The customer service is superb. They will go out of their way to accommodate any request, book tours or give advice on restaurants, sightseeing, etc. They keep your fridge stocked with plentiful breakfast items (eggs, ham, coffee, fruit, etc). Ask for the “Room with a View” if it’s available. You won’t be disappointed.

El lugar es hermoso , las habitaciones equipadas hasta con el más mínimo detalle,hermosa decoración . Te dejan todos los productos para preparar el desayuno , todo de calidad . El personal muy amable y preocupado de solucionar cualquier detalle . He visitado muchos lugares , pero este para mí es el mejor .

The suites are in a very convenient location.  Our suite (The Attic) was lovely. The service was welcoming and spectacular. Our host and the staff anticipated and accommodated our needs, including offering great suggestions; providing a delightful array of fresh fruits, bread, and breakfast foods; and arranging a wonderful tour with Xavier, who was generous with his kindness and knowledge of Ecuador. The great care put into converting the old mansion, preserves the historic charm while providing all the contemporary comforts! A wonderful place in Quito.
